Title: Consumer Analytics
Description:
About The Role

At Instabee, the consumer is at the core of everything we do, and you will play a key role in understanding and enhancing the consumer experience. Your insights will shape how we approach consumer growth, loyalty, and feedback, ensuring we continuously improve our services.

As a champion for the consumer, you’ll work closely with teams across the company to define and measure success. This role calls for a mix of analytical expertise, business acumen, and a deep curiosity about consumer behavior.

You won’t just report on data; you will help drive smarter decisions that shape the consumer journey and improve how we serve millions of users.

What you’ll be doing


Analyze consumer behavior and engagement to uncover insights and trends.
Develop and maintain KPIs related to consumer growth and experience.
Work with large datasets to find opportunities to improve acquisition, retention, and conversion.
Collaborate with Product, Tech, and Operations to test and launch consumer-facing initiatives.
Translate data into clear recommendations that enhance the customer journey.
Challenge how we do things today and explore new ways to understand and improve the consumer experience.
Support A/B testing and measure the impact of new strategies.
Present findings and actionable insights to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.


About You


You’re passionate about creating great consumer experiences and curious about what drives people’s behavior.
You possess a unique blend of analytical expertise and business acumen, enabling you to translate complex data into actionable strategies that drive real impact.
You thrive on testing and pioneering new approaches, pushing the boundaries of traditional consumer analytics.
You are not afraid to develop and implement novel tools and technologies to uncover deeper insights and solve challenging problems.
You are comfortable challenging the status quo, constantly seeking innovative ways to measure and improve the consumer journey.


What We’re Looking For


A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., engineering, IT, finance, economics, marketing, psychology).
2+ years of experience working with consumer data, such as segmentation, feedback, or behavior analysis.
Hands-on experience working with data tools like SQL, Python, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar.
Comfortable working with large datasets and performing data analysis.
Solid understanding of A/B testing and statistical methods.
Strong business sense and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Experience collaborating across departments (e.g., tech, product, marketing).
Experience presenting findings to senior stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills in English.


If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!

What you’ll get

We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!

Benefits

Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:


🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.


Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.

Get to know us

In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.

We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.

This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.

Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox — two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.

Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

Title: Data Modeler & Data Analyst Consultant
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.




We are looking for Data Modeler cum Data Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden with below expertise:




Job Description

Analyst for Recovery Data monitoring reports in Information capability ART
Able to work independently with defined problems on an average
level within specific platform and competence area Experience
with developing IT solutions able to take partial responsibility for
minor projects Experience in requirements gathering data analysis
data modelling and provide input to solution design Good
knowledge of relevant tools and technology
Most important MODELLING EXPERIENCE




Mandatory Skills : Data Vault (ODS) Modeling, Dimensional Data Modeling, ER Studio, MS SQL Server

Good to Have Skills : ANSI-SQL

Title: Data and Analytics summer intern 2025
Description:
Velory is now looking for a talent to join the data and analytics team from May 2025 (4-6 months). We are looking for applicants from holders of EU residence permits who are eligible to travel to and work in Stockholm.

This is Velory

Velory enables companies to buy and manage their IT in an automated, secure and circular way.


IT Lifecycle Management: streamlining IT workflows from purchase to end of life.
Employee Empowerment: unleashing productivity from the first day to the last


What you will do

You Will Be Part Of The Data And Operations Team And Interact Frequently With Sales, Product And Finance Teams. We Welcome And Seek a Dedicated Intern, Ready To Surprise Us With Creative Ideas, And Willing To Take The Lead On Small Projects. Here Are The Main Tasks You Will Perform


Data
Set up automated reporting
Make analyses of our business processes and customer interactions
Build models of customer behaviour
Office duty


As an intern you will help out on various other tasks, including writing texts, create product content, doing research.

You will also be helping out keeping the office nice, turn on the lights, water the plants, buy beers for office After Work parties ie.


Special project


If you want to, or your university requires you to, we will help you formulate a project that can be carried out alongside internship tasks during your time with us.

You are

Ideally a Business, Finance, Science or Engineering student with an interest in technology, data and analytics

Open-minded, willing to work in an international environment and meet new people.

Hardworking: A multitasker with a keen eye for detail.

Enthusiastic: You always have new ideas and try to implement them no matter what you are facing.

Passionate about disruptive innovation and digital solutions.

First-hand experience in a startup is valued.

You can write SQL queries, work with Excel formulas and pivot tables

Knowledge of web analytics is a plus but not a requirement

Able to use LLM chatbots (ChatGPT ie.) but not pass on your prompting results without understanding them

Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus but not necessary).

The internship

As an intern with Velory you will join a fast moving Swedish company on it's growth journey. You will work on finding solutions to new problems, and make the solutions scalable together with the other company teams, such as product team and finance team. You will both be driving your own and very challenging projects, as well as doing easier day-to-day tasks.

Examples Of Tasks

Build a concept for a CO2 emission effect model on behalf of a customer, showing the effect of choosing different computers and leasing contract lengths. The concept should be able to scale.

Write SQL queries to report NPS and CSAT scores by company on a monthly basis

Pick up the newspaper on your way into the office every day, turn on lights and office Spotify playlist at 08.00

Build a QA testing schema for an important product launch

Find more efficient ways to categorize support tickets that can be shared with partners using the same ticket handling system (Zendesk)

What We Offer

Travel cost recovery to Sweden/Stockholm if you are based in another country

Monthly stipend of 10 000 SEK (pre tax)

Gym with trainer every weekday

iPhone and MacBook as your personal productivity tools

2 paid vacation days offered per month worked

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are currently looking for a assisting an exciting Prop-tech scale up with the hiring of an experience data engineer with a background in AWS.




Our client is currently on a journey to revolutionise how home owners can use data and information from their own home to become more efficient. The goal is to expose areas in houses were energy use is higher and using AI help the owner create solutions to help.




Requirements:




5 Years of Software development experience - Data Focused
Highly experience in AWS
Experience within DevOps / CI/CD
Need to be Swedish Speaking and working in Stockholm




You will be joining a smaller organisation where you will have a unique opportunity to have your voice heard. Later down the line their aim is to build a larger team around this, therefore this role is ideal for senior candidates who aspire to one day become tech leads.




We offer:




We offer a great work environment with an exciting work culture that puts flexibility first. Our unique space in Stockholm has been creative created with developers in mind to promote knowledge sharing, collaboration and social atmosphere.







Benefits Offered:

30 days holiday
ITP1 Pension
Education allowance
Wellness allowance




Unfortunately this opportunity cannot offer any form of VISA sponsorship and you need to speak Swedish.




If this role could be of interest to you feel free to get in touch




tim.stokes@parallelconsulting.com

+46 85 502 486 58

Title: Analytical Consultant
Description:
Job Description

We are currently searching for an Analytical Consultant for the Customer Success, Industry Insights team in Stockholm, Sweden.

NIQ Customer Success team is focusing on building great customer experience by offering insights on category development and consumer buying behavior, in a timely and consistent manner. This role drives loyalty and empowerment by enhancing our customers' use of our data and tools through specialty expertise and engagement.

If you wish to work in a truly global company with an ambitious and positive work environment and a high focus on self-development, this position will be a perfect fit for you. As an Analytical Consultant you work with client support of any data and platform related issues as well as business solution-driven analyses, presentations and recommendations for one of today’s leading global FMCG companies.

Responsibilities


Improve the customer engagement and satisfaction of your assigned client by offering outstanding client support including data platform and analytical support
Develop valuable business issue analyses and category presentations
Deliver insights and recommendations to your client based on your analytical work
Generate sales leads based on your knowledge about your client’s business
Train your client in NIQ’s new cloud-based data platform Discover to increase their understanding and usage of the tool
Participate actively in building a positive and engaging team culture in our Nordic team


The role is based in our Stockholm office and reports to the Nordics Customer Success Leader. You will be part of a team of eight team members in total.

Qualifications


First and foremost a burning desire and ability to create and drive a commercial analytical base for identifying what's next for your client.
We expect 2-3 years of experience in the FMCG industry within business analysis, market research and/or category management
A commercial degree in Economics with proven graduation results
Strong Business English knowledge, both verbal and written and fluent in Swedish
Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills are a clear advantage
Experience with conducting presentations and good communication skills.


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

HTML:
Job Description

We are currently searching for an Analytical Consultant for the Customer Success, Industry Insights team in Stockholm, Sweden.

NIQ Customer Success team is focusing on building great customer experience by offering insights on category development and consumer buying behavior, in a timely and consistent manner. This role drives loyalty and empowerment by enhancing our customers' use of our data and tools through specialty expertise and engagement.

If you wish to work in a truly global company with an ambitious and positive work environment and a high focus on self-development, this position will be a perfect fit for you. As an Analytical Consultant you work with client support of any data and platform related issues as well as business solution-driven analyses, presentations and recommendations for one of today’s leading global FMCG companies.

Responsibilities

  • Improve the customer engagement and satisfaction of your assigned client by offering outstanding client support including data platform and analytical support
  • Develop valuable business issue analyses and category presentations
  • Deliver insights and recommendations to your client based on your analytical work
  • Generate sales leads based on your knowledge about your client’s business
  • Train your client in NIQ’s new cloud-based data platform Discover to increase their understanding and usage of the tool
  • Participate actively in building a positive and engaging team culture in our Nordic team

The role is based in our Stockholm office and reports to the Nordics Customer Success Leader. You will be part of a team of eight team members in total.

Qualifications

  • First and foremost a burning desire and ability to create and drive a commercial analytical base for identifying what's next for your client.
  • We expect 2-3 years of experience in the FMCG industry within business analysis, market research and/or category management
  • A commercial degree in Economics with proven graduation results
  • Strong Business English knowledge, both verbal and written and fluent in Swedish
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills are a clear advantage
  • Experience with conducting presentations and good communication skills.

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. Title: Impact Analyzer
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for a Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Reporting & insights, trend visualization, AI modelling, performance analysis
Responsible for the preparation, extrapolation and analysis of product and market
Analyze product / aftersales performance based on specific reports (price position, trends, competitors' actions)
Frequent reporting of campaign performance
Media KPIs (GRP, reach, impressions, clicks, CPC)
Number of qualified visitors, cost per QVs
Showroom traffic
Captive bank data analysis based on request
Supervise and monitor quarterly and seasonal campaigns & action plans, execution of European Aftersales marketing strategies and programs, webpage development
Review AS campaign data and evaluate the results of the performed campaign, lead strategic direction for future campaigns
Ensure sufficient training (internal) for reporting
Control budget related to the dealer data and systems
Managing special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national management


What we look for:


Minimum 5 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus
Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous
Experience in Data management / engineering
Higher education at Bachelors' level
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage
Analytical skills
Advanced PC skills
Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
Presentation skills
Data-driven decision-making
Borderless and virtual mindset
Ability to simplify
Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.




About the Data & Insights team

The Data & Insights team’s mission is to transform Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.

About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst at Trustly, you will look at the breadth of our data with a statistical mindset. Through your analytics skills and proficiency in handling data, you will uncover patterns and provide data-driven answers to complex strategic challenges. Depending on the stakeholder’s requests, you will choose adequate solutions to present your insights, ranging from dashboards in our BI tool to deep-dive analysis. In close collaboration with our data foundation team, you will be involved in building a strong and reliable data foundation that will support the analytics needs.




What you’ll do
Taking ownership of entire analytical projects, from defining objectives with our business stakeholders to delivering actionable insights and recommendations
Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and efficiency
Choose adequate analytical methods and tools to convey complex findings in a clear and concise manner
Continuously contribute to improve our Analytics capabilities 
Actively participate in establishing the data-driven culture at Trustly





Who you are
A Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or similar field
At least 3 years of experience within the analytics field, experience with the payments industry is a plus
Having a high degree of autonomy and being able to work independently on complex analyses
Solid and broad analytical skills-set including the ability to use statistical methods
Solid SQL and Python skills
Experience working with BI tools such as QlikSense or Tableau
Excellent communication skills 
Thrive in in a fast growing company








Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.

If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and kindly submit your CV in English.

Title: Analytiker
Description:
Är du student i slutskedet av din kandidat- eller masterutbildning och söker ett utvecklande extrajobb? Är du vass på att samla information & redovisa den? Vill du testa på något nytt?




Vi på Stellar erbjuder nämligen en unik möjlighet att hjälpa oss med dataanalys och research inom olika projekt. 




Om oss

Stellar accelererar företags lönsamhet genom digital marknadsföring. Från första kontraktet till lojala kunder – vi är med genom hela kundresan. För första gången samlar vi spetskompetenser inom CRM, analys, kreativt innehåll och försäljning under ett och samma tak. Våra experter samarbetar tillsammans för att attrahera, konvertera och bygga långsiktig kundlojalitet.  




Om rollen

Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med varierande projekt vid behov tillsammans med våra analytiker. Arbetsuppgifterna kan exempelvis inkludera:

Analys och sammanställning av insikter från intervjudata.
Beräkning av kundbasens livstidsvärde.
Implementering av maskininlärningsmodeller för att förutse marknadstrender.
Analys av marknadsresearch.
Skapande av nya datakällor och databaser utifrån kundens behov, exempelvis genom intervjuer och research.




Kvalifikationer

Vi söker dig som har:

Erfarenhet av programmering med fokus på statistisk analys (ex. Python, R, Matlab)
Kompetens inom dataanalys och paketering i Office-paketet (Excel, PowerPoint)
Erfarenhet av databashantering (ex. AWS, BigQuery) och analys i verktyg som Power BI, Azure, Qlik och Google Analytics
Kunskap om avancerade matematiska modeller, statistiska metoder och datahantering
Förmåga att identifiera mönster i stora datamängder, formulera hypoteser och visualisera insikter med relevanta metoder och modeller.




Anställningen

Anställningen är kontraktsbaserad, och projekt fördelas utifrån efterfrågan.




Ansökan

Låter detta intressant? Ansök nu! Vi rekryterar löpande. 




Frågor?

Mejla oss på hello@wearestellar.se återkopplar vi inom kort. 




Med vänliga hälsningar,

Team Stellar

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Are you capable of working with data and creating insights that inform important business decisions? Are you looking for a role where you can collaborate with a skilled team and shape decisions?

We’re looking for a Business Analyst to join our Commercial team at GlobalConnect. In this role, you’ll analyze data, develop models, and create clear recommendations to support business strategies. You’ll work closely with Business Managers, Product Managers, and others to ensure our decisions are backed by actionable insights. Whether you’re reviewing trends, preparing reports, or delivering presentations, your input will direct the way we move forward as a company.

About The Role

As a Business Analyst, your day-to-day work will focus on analyzing a large variety of data sets, developing financial models, and presenting your findings in a way that makes decision-making easier. You’ll be at the heart of our decision-making process, collaborating with a skilled team to guide key business strategies and initiatives.

On a typical day, you might:


Collaborate with Business Managers to turn data into insights that guide key decisions.
Build financial models to simulate business scenarios and evaluate opportunities.
Conduct market research and analyze trends to find new opportunities for growth.
Use Power BI or similar tools to visualize and present data clearly and intelligibly.
Deliver professional, persuasive presentations in PowerPoint, tailoring your insights for stakeholders at every level.


This is a key role where you’ll also need practical problem-solving skills to work through tasks like managing large datasets, ensuring models meet business needs, and navigating a shifting industry environment.

To Be Proficient in This Role, You’ll Need:


Experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar analytical role such as management consultant—backgrounds in telecom, real estate, or other relevant industries are beneficial.
Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to break down complex data, identify trends, and draw actionable conclusions using Excel (advanced level); experience with Power BI or similar tools is a plus.
Notable presentation skills, with the ability to create clear and meaningful insights using PowerPoint or other storytelling methods.
Fluency in both Swedish and English, written and spoken.


You are collaborative, curious, and thrive in roles where you can turn data into real-world business decisions.

Why Join Us?

At GlobalConnect, we don’t just analyze data—we use it to support our decision-making. In your first 6–12 months, you’ll:


Develop proficiency in our business models and analytical tools.
Deliver insights that directly influence our strategies and decisions.
Collaborate with a skilled team to refine and improve our analytical models.


This is your chance to join a forward-thinking company where your work will generate meaningful results across the Nordics.

Interested?

No personal letter is required unless you have something remarkable to share beyond your CV or LinkedIn profile. Apply now and let’s connect!
Show more

  • Collaborate with Business Managers to turn data into insights that guide key decisions.
  • Build financial models to simulate business scenarios and evaluate opportunities.
  • Conduct market research and analyze trends to find new opportunities for growth.
  • Use Power BI or similar tools to visualize and present data clearly and intelligibly.
  • Deliver professional, persuasive presentations in PowerPoint, tailoring your insights for stakeholders at every level.

This is a key role where you’ll also need practical problem-solving skills to work through tasks like managing large datasets, ensuring models meet business needs, and navigating a shifting industry environment.

To Be Proficient in This Role, You’ll Need:

  • Experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar analytical role such as management consultant—backgrounds in telecom, real estate, or other relevant industries are beneficial.
  • Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to break down complex data, identify trends, and draw actionable conclusions using Excel (advanced level); experience with Power BI or similar tools is a plus.
  • Notable presentation skills, with the ability to create clear and meaningful insights using PowerPoint or other storytelling methods.
  • Fluency in both Swedish and English, written and spoken.

You are collaborative, curious, and thrive in roles where you can turn data into real-world business decisions.

Why Join Us?

At GlobalConnect, we don’t just analyze data—we use it to support our decision-making. In your first 6–12 months, you’ll:

  • Develop proficiency in our business models and analytical tools.
  • Deliver insights that directly influence our strategies and decisions.
  • Collaborate with a skilled team to refine and improve our analytical models.

This is your chance to join a forward-thinking company where your work will generate meaningful results across the Nordics.

Interested?

No personal letter is required unless you have something remarkable to share beyond your CV or LinkedIn profile. Apply now and let’s connect!

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
About Kambi

Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

Kambi are looking for a highly motivated and experienced self-starter to join our quantitative analysis team in central Stockholm. For the right candidate, the position will provide the opportunity to research and develop cutting-edge algorithmic solutions to support our B2B Sportsbook operations. You will take a leading role in cross-functional teams, building complete trading and risk solutions, and where your main responsibility will be to develop and maintain risk and sport models. You will report to the Head of Quantitative Analytics.

Main responsibilities:



Support and work in close collaboration with trading, risk and other areas of the business by providing algorithmic solutions
Responsible for the end-to-end process of algorithm development, from inception to deployment as well as maintenance
Analysis and interpretation of data to produce meaningful information, in particular changes in patterns and trends
Communicate results and ideas to stakeholders



Skills and experience:



An academic degree in a quantitative discipline (computer science, mathematics, physics, etc.)
Previous experience in a similar role designing predictive models for real-world business problems
Advanced knowledge of stochastic processes, mathematical methods and probability theory
Proficiency with C/C++ and Python, in particular having worked in software teams (git) is a plus
Experience using statistical and query computer languages (R/SQL) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with cloud computing (AWS) is a plus
Familiarity with Apache Spark is a plus.
Skills in object-oriented programming is a plus



The successful candidate has:



Creative and experimental mindset to data mining
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development
A drive to promote innovative algorithmic solutions and data driven decision-making
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate to both business and technical minded colleagues
Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities



What's in it for you?



Opportunity to work in a fast-growing industry
A role within a highly ambitious team
Support for personal development
A fun and flexible working culture



We are curious about your story, if you are interested in meeting us please apply with your CV.

#wearekambi

Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace

If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.

Creating an inclusive environment

We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.

#wearekambi

Title: Salesforce Technical Lead
Description:
Job Title: Salesforce Technical Lead (Contract)

Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)

Contract Length: 12 months (Contract-to-Hire)

Start Date: 31st March 2025

Rate: DOE




My customer in the Financial Services industry is seeking an experienced Salesforce Technical Lead to join their team on an initial 12 months contract to go permanent. You will play a key role in customizing and developing the Salesforce platform to meet business requirements, ensuring optimal integration with other systems, and working on the early phases of a major implementation project.




As part of a cross-functional team, you will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, product owners, and technical leads to drive innovation and efficiency in our Salesforce environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and customize the Salesforce platform to align with business needs.
Optimize Salesforce integrations with external systems using REST/SOAP APIs.
Work on data modeling to ensure efficient storage and access.
Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Participate in strategic technology decisions to ensure scalability and efficiency.




Your Experience:

At least 5+ years of experience in Salesforce platform development.
Salesforce certifications.
Strong experience integrating external systems, preferably using REST/SOAP APIs.
Data modeling expertise for efficient storage and access.
Fluent in Swedish (both verbal and written).




Good to haves:

Experience with Financial Services Cloud (FSC).
Previous experience in the insurance industry.







This is a Contract-to-hire opportunity, transitioning to a permanent role after 12 months.




Please reach out to Daniel Indranathan if interested.

Title: Sustainability analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are currently looking for a driven and business minded Sustainability Analyst to complement our newly formed Sustainability Research team. The Sustainability Research team, consisting of three persons, is closely connected to the Credit and Equity Research teams at Danske Bank and is also part of the bank’s global Research team.

About Us

An essential part of the daily work in the Sustainability Research team is to produce and present company and sector reports on relevant environmental, social and governance (ESG) themes to local and international investors. Our reports aim to highlight the business relevance of the themes and their potential to create value for investors. In what ways can sustainability initiatives mitigate risks, improve profitability and create business value? Those are the types of questions we seek to answer.

About The Role

You will collect and analyse sustainability data for key Nordic sectors and companies to assess their materiality and to identify key business drivers and investment themes. You will ensure high standards of data handling and sustainability modelling, including proper documentation of sources, data management and quality control procedures. You will contribute to identifying material ESG risks and business benefits of sustainability initiatives and how they can affect a company’s business and financial profile.

Your profile

You should possess a keen interest in sustainability and a genuine enthusiasm for corporate analysis and financial markets. It is important that you enjoy teamwork and contribute to a positive working atmosphere. You should also possess a strong drive and creative mindset while enjoying proactive engagement. We would like you to share the target of being a Nordic benchmark in sustainability research and regard it as a stimulating challenge.

Since the role involves customer interaction and relationships, it is important that you enjoy giving presentations and have great social skills. You need to enjoy working in a high-paced environment with varying tasks and, at least periodically, dealing with intense workloads and tight deadlines. Additionally, being open to travelling is necessary due to Danske Bank's significant business activities in the rest of the Nordics and across Europe.


Relevant university degree
Three to five years of relevant working experience
Experience in sustainability initiatives in a corporate or financial environment is highly valued
Knowledge of financially relevant mathematics and programming is a plus
Deep proficiency in both Swedish and English, and other languages would be an advantage
Strong analytical skills


Our offer

We offer you an inspiring team and committed managers who encourages you to aim high. Here at Danske Bank we aim to provide professional services to our clients, while also having fun at work and a reasonable work / life balance. We see diversity and inclusion as a prerequisite for maintaining a high performance organisation, and a healthy, agile and innovative work place. We are very proud of our culture and believe our collaboration across product areas is key to our success.

Does this sound interesting?

Contact person: Louis Landeman, Head of Sustainability Research Danske Bank, Phone: +46 76 723 3485. Email: louis.landeman@danskebank.se

Send us your CV and application no later than the 24th of April. Please note that we are processing applications on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible.

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Junior Analytics Engineer
Description:
IPercept Technology AB

Job Title:  Junior Analytics Engineer

Job Type: Starting with an internship, with the potential to turn into full-time employment

Location: Stockholm, Sweden 

Job Summary

We are looking for a motivated Junior Analytics Engineer to join our team, starting as an intern with the opportunity to transition into a full-time role in the summer. This is a great opportunity for a recent graduate or final-year student with a strong technical background and a passion for analytics in mechanical and production systems.

We are looking for someone with a keen interest and knowledge in the following areas: 

What You’ll Do


Work with mechanical systems and production machinery data
Develop analytics solutions using Python and signal processing techniques (FFT, filters, etc.)
Assist in extracting insights from machine data to improve efficiency and performance
Collaborate with engineers to enhance data-driven decision-making


Must-haves 


Knowledge of mechanical systems  
Understanding of production machinery
Python 
Signal Processing (FFT, Filters, etc.) 


Nice to have


Software Engineering Fundamentals
SQL


What’s in it for you?   


Being a young company it’s all about the people - we’re a bunch of passionate and driven people with whom you will have a great time.   
Psychological safety and internal trust - flexible working hours, high expectations combined with a humane approach to work/life balance.  
Flat organization - we hire you because we believe in you. So challenge what we take for granted, express yourself and wear what you always dreamed of wearing to work, have fun, participate and make this the company you always dreamed of working for. 


How To Apply   

Submit a resume and cover letter outlining your interest and relevant experience

About IPercept

Imagine knowing the mechanical health of a machine without touching it, being alerted well in advance before something breaks, understanding how a machine is truly being used, and identifying what needs attention on a component level before visiting the machine.

At IPercept, we make this possible. Our insights help manufacturers understand their machines’ true state and usage throughout the machine life-cycle, achieving a 30% increase in efficiency. This quick ROI is realized by minimizing downtime, enhancing productivity, and reducing scrap rates, tooling costs, maintenance parts, and energy consumption.

In just two years, over 20 of Europe’s largest manufacturers have trusted us, and none have looked back.

We look forward to seeing your application!

/ IPercept Team

Title: ESG Analyst
Description:
Explore exciting opportunities for professional growth and development in the ESG domain, and make a meaningful impact in sustainable investing with our dynamic team!




ESG ANALYST

Permian is a leading fund administration firm dedicated to providing comprehensive services to private equity investing firms and fund managers.




Role Overview:

Permian is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented ESG Analyst to join our growing ESG team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to ESG services, supporting data management, reporting, and operational processes while learning from teamwork with senior ESG experts.




Key responsibilities:

Assist in ESG data collection, validation, and reporting for clients, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory frameworks (SFDR, CSRD, EU Taxonomy).
Support the implementation and maintenance of ESG reporting tools and software systems.
Collaborate with senior ESG specialists on ESG service delivery, including product development, client presentations, and data analysis.
Conduct research on ESG trends, regulatory updates, and best practices to keep Permian’s services current.
Develop and maintain ESG-related documentation, including reporting templates, KPIs, and client materials.




Qualifications:

A degree in Sustainability, Environmental Science, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in ESG, sustainability, data analysis, or related roles.
Familiarity with ESG regulations and reporting standards is a plus.
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and ideally but not a must in ESG reporting tools or platforms.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Proactive mindset with a willingness to learn and grow in the ESG space.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks.




Why join us?

Be a cornerstone of our ESG services and supporting sustainable investment practices for top-tier private equity firms.
Collaborate with a supportive and innovative team dedicated to excellence.
Opportunity for professional growth and development in the ESG domain.




Applications will be reviewed continuously as they are received. We look forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who isimmediate joinerand want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
Good knowledge of Terraform
Experience in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
Experience in data modelling and transformation using dbt.
Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.


Additional Information

Start:Immediate

Location:Stockholm, Sweden

Form of employment:Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Locations:Stockholm

Note: Please apply only if you are currently residing in Sweden.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who isimmediate joinerand want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
  • Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
  • Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
  • Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
  • Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
  • Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
  • Good knowledge of Terraform
  • Experience in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
  • Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
  • Experience in data modelling and transformation using dbt.
  • Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.

Additional Information

Start:Immediate

Location:Stockholm, Sweden

Form of employment:Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Locations:Stockholm

Note: Please apply only if you are currently residing in Sweden.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
Be a productive member of the team.


Requirements


At least 4+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer working with GCP or other modern cloud data platforms, or advanced analytics environments.
Take full ownership of building, optimizing, and supporting both new and existing data products, aligning them with the defined target vision.
Champion a DevOps mindset, managing CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, and Cloud infrastructure, specifically within Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Ensure data products are deployed as independent units and that non-functional aspects such as security, scalability, observability, and performance align with established standards.
Collaborate closely with the Product Manager and stakeholders to refine the vision for existing data products and identify new opportunities to meet customer needs.
Work with cross-functional product teams on topics related to the data mesh concept.
Continuously evaluate and drive improvements to reduce technical debt within the teams.
Stay up-to-date with the latest data, analytics, and cloud technologies.
Strong experience with cloud technologies and infrastructure.
Specific expertise with GCP tools, including Dataflow, Dataproc, and BigQuery.
Experience working with various data formats such as Parquet and Avro.
Proficient in data query languages (e.g., SQL or similar).
Strong background in data-centric programming, using Python, Java, or Scala.
Good understanding of various data modeling techniques and the trade-offs involved.
Familiarity with both NoSQL and RDBMS databases.


Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.
Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: Data Modeller
Description:
Job Description

Insights & Data is a global business line within Capgemini, consisting of 27,000 experts. Our focus? To create groundbreaking machine learning and AI solutions with reliable and scalable data platforms. From business analysis to Gen-AI, we cover it all! We work across all industries and have a collaborative environment and culture where your unique perspective matters.

The places that you work from day to day will vary according to your role, your needs, and those of the business; it will be a blend of Company offices, client sites, and your home; noting that you will be unable to work at home 100% of the time. 

YOUR ROLE

We are now looking for an engaged Data Modeller with experience in the financial sector. In this role, you will work across multiple solutions and technologies within the team's scope and be responsible for data modeling and data architecture solutions.

Additionally, you will:


Create and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models for databases and data warehouses.
Optimize data structures for performance, scalability, and reliability.
Work closely with business analysts, data architects, and software developers to understand data needs.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data-related projects.
Ensure data models align with organizational standards and governance policies.
Develop and enforce data modeling best practices and standards.


YOUR PROFILE

To be successful in this role, we see that you have approximately 5+ years of experience in data modeling with a background in the financial sector. You are proficient in gathering and analyzing requirements, creating conceptual, logical, and physical data models, and optimizing data structures using tools like Erwin, IBM Data Architect (or similar). You should also be familiar with ETL processes, data warehousing, and data lakes.

Additionally, we value:


A Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in information technology or computer science
Previous consulting experience
Excellent communication skills, fluent in English
A solid understanding of data governance frameworks and best practices
Familiarity with big data and relational database systems


About

WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE

We value the importance of flexible work arrangements to support our employees' daily lives. Whether it's remote work or flexible working hours, our goal is to create an environment where you can maintain a healthy work-life balance. At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our range of training, career programs, and various roles are designed to help you explore a world of opportunities. Whether you want to equip yourself with valuable certifications or develop your role as a leader, we want to ensure we offer what you need.

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
Show more

Title: Business Developer till Data & Analys
Description:
Vi söker dig som brinner för att förvandla data till insikter och möjligheter. Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad – både för SJ och våra kunder.


SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.

Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.

Din kommande roll
Som Business Developer blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:

Analysera krav och verksamhetsprocesser med syfte att hitta bästa lösning och väg till det värde som söks
Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
Hålla samman tvärfunktionella team i arbetet med att realisera de värdeskapande leveranser Data & Analys åtagit sig
Agera brygga mellan intressenter tvärs hela koncernen och alla typer av roller
Upptäcka och utveckla potentialen i SJs data genom moderna tekniker, metoder och arbetssätt
Stötta i SJs datakvalitetsarbete och på så sätt möjliggöra ytterligare utväxling och effektivisering kring data

Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, men även nära Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.

Förväntningar på den vi söker

En akademisk examen inom systemvetenskap, ingenjörsutbildning eller liknande tekniskt orienterad utbildning
Erfarenhet av att driva samverkan mellan kravställare och teknisk leverans, gärna i en analytisk och komplex kontext och antagligen i en roll som konsult
En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med ett stort intresse för att lösa komplexa problem och göra skillnad
Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder såsom SAFe och hur dessa tillämpas effektivt i en tvärfunktionell leverans
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift
Intresse och erfarenhet kring datamodellering och -kvalitetsarbete är meriterande


Ansökan och information
Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 23 januari 2025.

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SJ med Jefferson Wells och Experis. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Malin Magnusson, 076-7806864, malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se, och Anki Snis, 0703-775969, anki.snis@se.experis.com.

  • Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder såsom SAFe och hur dessa tillämpas effektivt i en tvärfunktionell leverans

  • Intresse och erfarenhet kring datamodellering och -kvalitetsarbete är meriterande


Ansökan och information
Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 23 januari 2025.

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SJ med Jefferson Wells och Experis. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Malin Magnusson, 076-7806864, malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se, och Anki Snis, 0703-775969, anki.snis@se.experis.com.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a dynamic and driven Data Engineer and Analyst to join our team, working with the latest analytics technologies to provide crucial insights for the construction project of our factory. The role focuses on understanding stakeholder requirements and delivering BI reports and analytical solutions using our data stack consisting of a data lake (AWS S3), data warehouse (Snowflake + DBT) and visualization layer (Power BI). We are looking for someone that wants to collaborate with the business and understand their goals and challenges to align solutions to their needs.

Role

Data Expertise
Proven experience in data engineering and analytics, specializing in BI reporting. Experience with data mesh is a plus.
Technical Skills
AWS S3, Snowflake, DBT and Power BI - or similar tools. Experience in Kotlin or Java is a plus (we use Kotlin microservices for data ingestion).
Stakeholder Engagement
Ability to gather and translate business requirements into data solutions.
Data Modeling
Skilled in mapping business processes and terminology into data models.
Communication
Good verbal and written skills for effective collaboration.
Solution Ownership
Able to drive a solution from requirements to end product and have ownership of the solution to make sure it continuously satisfies business needs

Examples of Activities

Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports.
Set up and manage data pipelines using Kotlin microservices and AWS S3.
Collect data from multiple sources, package them into data products in Snowflake with DBT and create BI reports to provide business insights.
Collaborate with business architects to ensure data models reflect business needs.
Work closely with business stakeholders, building relationships and trust.
Ensure data models and reports accurately represent business processes.
Create and manage applications for manual data management in Airtable.
Show more

Title: Data Analysis Manager
Description:
Är du en erfaren dataanalytiker som vill vara en ledare för Humanas Analytics team i Stockholm? Humana är en framstående aktör inom vård och omsorg, dedikerade till att använda data för att förbättra våra processer och beslut. Vi söker dig som är en erfaren Data Analyst som brinner för att effektivisera och automatisera. Vill du ta steget till att ta ett teamansvar?




Missa inte denna chans att bli chef för Data och Analytics teamet hos Humana!




OM TEAMET

Du kommer att jobba tillsammans med dina skickliga kollegor i Analytics teamet. Du kommer att arbeta med dataanalyser och forma effektiva arbetssätt. I rollen som chef för teamet har du både frontend och backend kollegor som analyserar och tolkar komplexa datamängder för att identifiera mönster, trender och insikter. Du kommer primärt att jobba med Mercur som är vårt verktyg för ekonomiska rapporter medan övriga rapporter hanteras i Power BI i dagsläget.







Du är ansvarig för ett mindre analyticsteam.
Du kommer att arbeta med kravställning, modellera data i vårt datalager och bygga rapporter.
I rollen jobbar du från IT nära ekonomiavdelningen och ger ett stort tekniskt stöd vad gäller ekonomiska rapporter, men även med övriga delar inom organisationen.
Ditt team arbetar med spännande projekt i framkanten av datadrivet beslutsfattande.
Teamet värdesätter kontinuerligt lärande, innovation och personlig utveckling.







Placeringsort är Humanas Stockholmskontor i Stadshagen och du kommer ingå i ett team bestående av sex drivna och engagerade kollegor. Du har möjlighet att arbeta på distans två dagar i veckan.







DIN BAKGRUND

Du har flera års erfarenhet av dataanalyser där du är van att jobba med datavisualiseringsplattformar och skapande av användarvänliga dashboards. Vi ser gärna att du har jobbat med dataanalysprogram och erfarenhet av modellering av data. Vi tror att du i grunden har en utbildning inom dataanalys, ekonomi eller motsvarande.




• Som person är du positiv och engagerad, med förmåga att driva och leda en grupp.

• Du har en god förmåga att kommunicera komplex data på ett tydligt och effektivt sätt till olika delar i verksamheten.

• I arbetet är du strukturerad och noggrann och mån om att leverera med kvalitet.

• Du är van att arbeta med SQL.

• Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.




OM HUMANA OCH VAD VI SÖKER




Vi erbjuder en dynamisk roll i en ledande organisation inom vård och omsorg där du får möjlighet att arbeta med datadrivna lösningar och bidra till positiva förändringar. Som ledare för ett team hos oss har du en nyckelroll på bolaget och din kompetens och erfarenhet är viktig.










Humana erbjuder tjänster inom personlig assistans, individ- och familjeomsorg, äldreomsorg och bostäder med särskild service enligt LSS, Lagen om stöd och service för vissa funktionshindrade. Humana har 20 000 engagerade medarbetare i Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Finland som utför omsorgstjänster till över 9 000 människor. Vi har en prestigelös arbetsmiljö där vi uppmuntrar varandra till delaktighet och att sprida glädje på jobbet. Här drivs vi av utveckling och arbetar ständigt för att förbättra kvaliteten i vår verksamhet, där du som medarbetare är en viktig del i detta arbete.










Är det dig vi söker eller har du tips på en bra person till rollen?

Välkommen in med din ansökan, urval sker löpande så ansök redan idag. Har du tips på en bra person eller om du har frågor om rollen är du välkommen att kontakta Linda Mukka på Linda.mukka@houseofskills.se eller Linda Freij på mail Linda.freij@houseofskills.se.







VÄLKOMMEN MED DIN ANSÖKAN!

Show more
