HTML:
Data Analyst, Retail - Interim

Do you have a keen eye for detail and a structured approach to your work? Are you looking for the opportunity to leverage your strong analytical skillset and work with data that affect business decisions? And, do you want to work alongside can-do spirited people who are striving for excellence? Then, keep on reading!

About The Role

We’re looking for a Retail Data Analyst to join us on an interim contract until December 2025. As our new colleague, you will be collaborating with the other team members (Data Engineers, Data Scientists, etc.) and providing feedback on the data pipelines. You will be working with management to prioritize business and information needs, while also locating and defining new process improvement opportunities. You will have the ability to build a larger business narrative around data, and communicate the insights derived to a broader array of business stakeholders.

Additionally, the role responsibilities will include:

  • Acting as the face of the product team with business stakeholders as needed.
  • Creating and maintaining the logic and processes to support trustworthy and efficient consumption of business data.
  • Developing and implementing databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
  • Investigating data sources across enterprise, and expanding existing search data infrastructure, identifying opportunities to expand modelling and customer obsession efforts.
  • Filtering and cleaning data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
  • Identifying, developing, managing, and executing analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will help grow the search business internally and for partners worldwide.
  • Identifying opportunities for developing new data sources and providing technical leadership around making those data sources high quality and broadly available.


In order to succeed:

You are a strong team player who likes to take ownership and has a results-driven approach. You strive for excellence and are focused on delivering results with high standards. You are comfortable giving definition to ambiguous problems, and you enjoy working independently with limited guidance. You’re able to build a story around the data and convey the findings of the analysis to several business and non-business stakeholders.

In addition, we hope that you have and can demonstrate:

  • 1-3+ years of professional experience in data modelling and advanced business analytics, with 2+ years of SQL and experience with efficient processing of large data sets.
  • Bachelor’s (or relevant work experience) in a quantitative discipline like Computer science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering etc.
  • Proficiency in big data analytics tools (R, Python etc.) and standard analytics packages like SPSS.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication & data presentation skills, including experience to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
  • Experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with big data technologies and large-scale, complex datasets.
  • Experience in designing and building data infrastructure/automated reporting tools.
  • Experience in advanced business/customer analytics.


Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst with a passion for data? Do you want to be a driving force in unlocking the potential of data in a growing business? Then come join us!

At BESTSELLER we are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics Wholesale team. A colleague with the experience and skillset to keep our current solutions running seamlessly, while orchestrating a gradual transfer into a state-of-the-art setup.

YOUR TEAM

You will be part of our Data & Analytics department consisting of 60 colleagues, who all share the same passion for data and who actively drive the data agenda across BESTSELLER. Our goal is to deliver value to our end stakeholders such as JACK & JONES and ONLY BRAND HOUSE, ensuring that satisfaction and quality are always on the radar. More specifically, you will join 9 dedicated professionals in our Wholesale team, sharing the passion for creating products and making good products even better. To achieve this, we create tools that automate decisions with data and insights.

YOUR JOB

Our everyday work is implementing new solutions to our data model and datasets, all done in close collaboration with our brands, markets, and other core functions.

Your role in this will be to:


Maintain, develop and improve Power BI datasets focusing on performance and business relevance
Develop, maintain, and burst central Power BI reports
Monitor our Power BI capacity and follow-up with users in case of inappropriate consumption
Support the development of new data products


As Data Analyst in our Wholesale team, you will play a significant role in developing our current data models, collect stakeholder needs, suggest great solutions and transforming our current Data Warehouse environment into a more future-proof Data Mesh setup. More specifically, your tasks include:


Optimizing data modelling
Complex DAX requests for data models or for stakeholders
Incorporate stakeholder needs into current and future data models
Participate in meetings with several stakeholders to discuss needs and potentials solutions


Your Benefits

In this role, you will get a versatile and challenging position in a fast-paced environment with rapid decision-making processes. You'll join a fantastic team that collaborates closely internally and with a variety of business stakeholders. We offer exceptional opportunities to learn new skills in an international environment that embraces diverse cultures, along with access to a wide range of certifications and dedicated weekly training hours. Furthermore, we offer you the flexibility of working from home two days a week.

TO BECOME A SUCCESFUL DATA ANALYST

We are looking for someone who is naturally curious about new methods and technologies, and who approaches challenges with thoroughness and a systematic, analytical mindset. The ideal candidate will be able to take ownership of the wholesale consumption of our Power BI capacity, ensuring high performance across the organization. It will be beneficial to have a deep understanding of stakeholder management, enabling you to grasp business needs and effectively communicate these insights to Product Owners and Developers. Furthermore, you are comfortable challenging both internal processes and external solutions to drive continuous improvement.

Moreover, we imagine you:


Have min. 1-2 years of experience with Data modeling and DAX.
Have a technical understanding of Tabular Editor, Power BI, and Basic SQL.
Are fluent in English, both written and spoken.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact manager, Jens Rasmussen, +45 20 56 11 60. Otherwise, please submit your CV and application as soon as possible, and no later than 21th of April 2025. We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the advertisement when we have found the right candidate.

WORK LOCATION

Our team is based in our headquarters in Aarhus C and Brande. You are free to choose one of these locations as your primary workplace. However, we expect that you will be present at your secondary workplace at least once a week.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about enabling insights to be discovered through data? Do you have a keen eye for how to best visualize and communicate with data through reporting and analytics solutions? Do you want to assist in enabling data-informed decision making in area of Supply & Distribution to grow the world’s largest jewelry brand? If yes, you are the person we are looking for. As our new data visualization specialist, you will play a pivotal role in making sure that we create technical analytics solutions that solve real business problems and engage users to drive adoption.

Transform, model and visualize data

At PANDORA, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new Data Visualization Specialist, you will collaborate with product managers, data engineers, stakeholders, and end-users across the global organization. You will help business verticals and clusters maximize the value of our data and drive impactful business change.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing analytics solutions on our global data platform along with our team of excellent engineers in the organization.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  


Working closely with your products team to design efficient, stable, and to-the-point products to drive commercial business value through reporting, self-service analytics and other data communication cases.
Creating and maintaining high-quality and high-performance Power BI reports and semantic models.
Taking ownership of your products and continuously tracking stability, adoption, and impact.
Ensuring that great user experiences are at the heart of all deliverables.
Delivering self-service solutions for end-users and training them in their usage.
Working with stakeholders and end-users to assist with data-related technical challenges.
Following best practices and existing guidelines but also challenging the status quo.



Team Player With Strong Analytical Skills

We are looking for a real team player with a product-oriented, can-do attitude who is both technically proficient but also able to engage with end-users. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, we are looking for a confident communicator that can explain solution designs and can tailor their message and solutions according to the audience.

You’re perfect for this role if you have:


Relevant education within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field, however experience and passion for data analytics is most important.
At least 2 years of experience working with BI, data preparation, and visualization.
Experience from a global retail organization.
Experience with Power BI, DAX, Analysis Services, Tabular Editor, SSMS, Databricks, Power Automate, Power Apps, and Jira.
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL and Tabular models.
High proficiency in English and ability to communicate at all levels of technical competence.
Agile mindset and experience with Scrum and agile ways of working.



Your new team

You will be an essential asset to one of PANDORA’s Data & Analytics product teams, consisting of data engineers, business analysts, scrum masters, and product managers who all enable our global business users in making impactful decisions informed by data. You will join our Digital Hub in Havneholmen, a peninsula on Kalvebod Brygge with a great view over Copenhagen Harbour.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake 

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Remote Data Analyst
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us prepare for the energy challenges of the future and create a green footprint – join a team that works to improve the future for us and our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We take pride in offering our employees flexibility and work diligently to build a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is committed to providing equal opportunities for all employees. We celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for everyone.

Our culture is based on trust and focuses on recognition, diversity, and continuous learning. What makes us a global team is that we value our employees and prioritize their safety

The Remote Data Analytics (RDA) team is seeking a new colleague, preferably with commissioning, troubleshooting, and hands-on experience with Siemens' wind turbines. Experience with other turbine brands might also be suitable. The team remotely monitors installed turbines and operates 24/7/365, addressing active alarms through a local online system combined with diagnostic tools. Their goal is to save technician hours and increase turbine availability.

You will be part of a team of 12 highly qualified and dedicated Remote Data Analysts, working in shifts with 1-2 other colleagues in an engaged monitoring room, some positions outside Denmark are worked from home or local SGRE office.

The position is in Brande Denmark, as well as elsewhere as mentioned above.

How can you contribute to our vision?


Your job will be to diagnose and interpret remotely collected data from faulty turbines, formulating troubleshooting guides in English based on this data, which you will send to the service technicians who will troubleshoot the turbine.
You take pride in getting stopped turbines up and running as quickly and responsibly as possible – and keeping them running.
You will keep yourself and the team updated on all platforms through on-site visits and training as needed.
You will be part of a 6-week rotating shift consisting of: 5 weekdays (07:00 - 15:10), 5 weekday evenings (15:00 - 23:10), 5 weekday nights (23:00 - 07:10), 2 weekend days (07:00 - 19:10), and 2 weekend nights (19:00 - 07:10). You will then have the remaining 2 weeks and 5 weekdays off in the rotating shift. Occasional paid overtime can be expected.
We prefer that you have a background as a troubleshooting/commissioning technician with practical experience from Siemens wind turbines, but you are now looking for a career shift to an office environment.


How can you make a difference?


You have a mechanical and/or electrical education and preferably some years of practical experience.
You can formulate a tailored troubleshooting guide in English based on remotely collected data combined with your knowledge of Siemens wind turbines (WTC-3, SICS, geared and DD platforms).
You have experience with Office 365 and generally good IT understanding.
You are flexible, service-minded, and take pride in keeping systems and turbines operational. You thrive in a hectic and dynamic environment where you are proactive in your work.
It would be an advantage if you have experience with WPS, cRSP, and MORS (though not required).
As a person, you are analytical, detail- and result-oriented. You are passionate without compromising on quality. You have the ability to work independently and in a team, and you are motivated by routine tasks in front of a computer.
You are a skilled communicator and fluent in English, both verbally and in technical writing.


If you have acquired your skills in alternative ways, your application is also appreciated.

In return of your commitment we offer you…


Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.
We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality.
We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.
Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more


Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Brian Schmidt-Bjørnskov, via +45 30 37 53 69.

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please send the recruiting team an email via nisha.deshpande.ext@siemensgamesa.com.

Please mention the Job ID in the email.

Please apply in English via the apply button.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.
Show more
HTML:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us prepare for the energy challenges of the future and create a green footprint – join a team that works to improve the future for us and our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We take pride in offering our employees flexibility and work diligently to build a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is committed to providing equal opportunities for all employees. We celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for everyone.

Our culture is based on trust and focuses on recognition, diversity, and continuous learning. What makes us a global team is that we value our employees and prioritize their safety

The Remote Data Analytics (RDA) team is seeking a new colleague, preferably with commissioning, troubleshooting, and hands-on experience with Siemens' wind turbines. Experience with other turbine brands might also be suitable. The team remotely monitors installed turbines and operates 24/7/365, addressing active alarms through a local online system combined with diagnostic tools. Their goal is to save technician hours and increase turbine availability.

You will be part of a team of 12 highly qualified and dedicated Remote Data Analysts, working in shifts with 1-2 other colleagues in an engaged monitoring room, some positions outside Denmark are worked from home or local SGRE office.

The position is in Brande Denmark, as well as elsewhere as mentioned above.

How can you contribute to our vision?

  • Your job will be to diagnose and interpret remotely collected data from faulty turbines, formulating troubleshooting guides in English based on this data, which you will send to the service technicians who will troubleshoot the turbine.
  • You take pride in getting stopped turbines up and running as quickly and responsibly as possible – and keeping them running.
  • You will keep yourself and the team updated on all platforms through on-site visits and training as needed.
  • You will be part of a 6-week rotating shift consisting of: 5 weekdays (07:00 - 15:10), 5 weekday evenings (15:00 - 23:10), 5 weekday nights (23:00 - 07:10), 2 weekend days (07:00 - 19:10), and 2 weekend nights (19:00 - 07:10). You will then have the remaining 2 weeks and 5 weekdays off in the rotating shift. Occasional paid overtime can be expected.
  • We prefer that you have a background as a troubleshooting/commissioning technician with practical experience from Siemens wind turbines, but you are now looking for a career shift to an office environment.

How can you make a difference?

  • You have a mechanical and/or electrical education and preferably some years of practical experience.
  • You can formulate a tailored troubleshooting guide in English based on remotely collected data combined with your knowledge of Siemens wind turbines (WTC-3, SICS, geared and DD platforms).
  • You have experience with Office 365 and generally good IT understanding.
  • You are flexible, service-minded, and take pride in keeping systems and turbines operational. You thrive in a hectic and dynamic environment where you are proactive in your work.
  • It would be an advantage if you have experience with WPS, cRSP, and MORS (though not required).
  • As a person, you are analytical, detail- and result-oriented. You are passionate without compromising on quality. You have the ability to work independently and in a team, and you are motivated by routine tasks in front of a computer.
  • You are a skilled communicator and fluent in English, both verbally and in technical writing.

If you have acquired your skills in alternative ways, your application is also appreciated.

In return of your commitment we offer you…

  • Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.
  • We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality.
  • We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.
  • Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more

Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Brian Schmidt-Bjørnskov, via +45 30 37 53 69.

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please send the recruiting team an email via nisha.deshpande.ext@siemensgamesa.com.

Please mention the Job ID in the email.

Please apply in English via the apply button.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.

We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Business Intelligence Intern
Description:
Gain invaluable practical experience with data analysis and Business Intelligence – Vitec Visiolink is looking for a Business Intelligence intern for the period August-December 2025.  




As an intern in the Business Consulting department at Visiolink, you will be an active player in the exploration of data and trends based on large amounts of data in Google Analytics.  




BI prepares reports and other products for the benefit of our customers, ensures data quality and uses data to inspire customers for strategic initiatives that increase reader engagement in their e-newspapers. As an intern, you will become part of the team on an equal footing with other employees.   




About the internship 

During the internship, you will gain insight into, and practical experience with all the tasks that cross our desks every day. The course will also offer events outside the house such as customer meetings, presentations and external events. You will largely help shape your internship, where the tasks can consist of:  




• Analysis of large amounts of data (in Google Analytics 4, Python/R, Google BigQuery)  

• Data collection, structuring and visualization  

• User behaviour analysis   

• Creating reports and presentations   

• Automation through Python/R and Google BigQuery  

• Data visualizations through Looker studio  




About you 

You are probably studying Business Intelligence, Business Economics, Information Technology or something in that vein. 

We ensure that you have good conditions for your learning, and throughout your stay we focus on strengthening your skills. Together we will find the projects you are the most interested in and develop your internship form there.  

 

• You have experience in data science and analysis  

• You have experience with Python, R , or SQL  

• You love exploring data, and you have your focus and interests within analysis and dissemination of data 

• You are curious, result-oriented and passionate about translating theoretical understanding into a practical and application-oriented reality.   




About Vitec Visiolink 

Vitec Visiolink is a market-leading supplier of digital publishing solutions for the European media industry. We produce solutions for digital distribution in the form of e-newspapers and magazines, podcasts, newspaper archives, live news, etc. with 250 media houses in Europe, and more than 2,000 titles are distributed every day.  

 

In Vitec Visiolink you will find 50 competent and committed colleagues who are all passionate about making a difference.  

 

We have a flat organizational structure, where there is high ceiling and the opportunity to make your own mark - regardless of whether you are an intern, specialist or manager. Our active staff association ensures that we also have some great experiences together outside of working hours.   

Practical information 

The internship is 37 hours per week and is unpaid. However, a lunch buffet is included, as well as other employee benefits and events. We are processing applications on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate to send in your application. 

 

FYI: Vitec Visiolink is currently located on Bjørnholms Alle 20, 8260 Viby J, but we are moving to new premises in Aarhus C at the end of September.  

 

Are you interested? 

 

Send your application through LinkedIn with your CV and motivated application.

 

Any questions regarding the position can be directed to business intelligence specialist Cecilie Vestergaard at cecilie.vestergaard@vitecsoftware.com or Product Manager, Per Gylling at per.gylling@vitecsoftware.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For a newly created position, we are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to ensure continuous improvement, development, and timely delivery of regulatory reporting.




Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark is a leading player in the automotive financial services industry, operating as a joint venture between Semler Gruppen and Volkswagen Financial Services. To enhance reporting structures and meet evolving European standards, Moment Search & Selection is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join the IT-PMO team in Brøndby and to take on a key role in a newly created position.




Drive Data Excellence while bridging Business and Data.

With increased regulatory demands from the European Central Bank and the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA), you will play a crucial role in ensuring compliance, optimizing data processes, and driving continuous improvement in regulatory reporting. You will join a dynamic and forward-thinking environment where innovation, collaboration, and adaptability are key drivers of success. At Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark, you will be part of an international and growth-oriented organization that values your analytical thinking, proactive problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration.




In this role, you will be the link between business and data, ensuring that regulatory demands are translated into effective, data-driven solutions. You will work closely with skilled colleagues in IT, Finance, and Risk to develop high-quality reporting solutions and your key responsibilities will include:




Define, analyze, and refine regulatory reporting requirements from business owners and stakeholders.
Collaborate with business owners to produce detailed specifications and work with developers to translate these into SQL.
Represent business requirements, working closely with developers to ensure accurate implementation.
Participate in and facilitate testing with business stakeholders, ensuring all requirements are met.
Work effectively within agile teams, contributing to sprints and iterative development processes.
Develop and specify requirements for reports and data warehouses to support a variety of business needs beyond regulatory reporting.
Navigate and contribute to a complex international environment, ensuring compliance with global standards and best practices.




In this role, you will also need to build and maintain close working relationships with stakeholders at various levels. You will demonstrate strong analytical skills to ensure data integrity and quality in complex environments.




Your qualifications

To succeed in this role, you must have significant experience with complex data transformations and regulatory reporting. You should have a deep understanding of managing large datasets and collaborating across departments, and you must be able to communicate confidently in English, both verbally and in writing.




You hold a bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, finance, or in a related field and have at least five years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the financial sector. A strong proficiency in SQL and data warehousing is essential, and experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Qlik will be an advantage. Experience with data governance and GDPR compliance is essential.




You have developed a robust technical expertise that enables you to ask critical questions and provide guidance when needed. Additionally, you will act as a "safety net" for data handling, ensuring that data is managed accurately and in full compliance with relevant regulations and standards, both within Danish and German law.




Join an international workplace with significant opportunities for professional and personal growth.




At Moment Search & Selection, we are handling the recruitment of Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark’s new Data Analyst. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t hesitate to apply if this sounds like your next challenge! Once the right candidate is found, the recruitment process will be closed.




If you have any questions regarding the position, feel free to contact Senior Recruitment Consultant, Morten Thomsen, on mobile +45 31365625.




About Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark

Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark A/S is a leading player in the automotive financial services industry, operating as a joint venture between Semler Gruppen and Volkswagen Financial Services. Semler Gruppen, with over 100 years of experience, is Denmark’s largest car importer, representing renowned brands such as Volkswagen, Audi, Skoda, Porsche, and Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles. Volkswagen Financial Services, a division of the Volkswagen Group, operates across 48 markets globally, making it the world’s largest provider of financial products and services to the automotive sector. Together, the two partners offer comprehensive and flexible financial, leasing, insurance, and mobility services to customers and dealers in Denmark.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.  

We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a Data Analyst in our Copenhagen office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change? 

The Role 

As a Data Analyst at Viaplay Group, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling us to deliver exceptional experiences to our customers. By leveraging your analytical, visualization, and data modeling skills, you’ll inspire and lead the way toward a more data-informed business. Collaborating with diverse teams, you’ll be integral in evaluating trends, optimizing strategies, and supporting data-driven decision-making. Your expertise will help shape the future of Viaplay Group through enhanced user engagement, content performance, and operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business strategies and improve user experiences
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to bring the business closer to data by offering expertise, advice, and insights. Actively contribute to creating a data-informed culture across all levels of the organization
Data Visualization: Build dashboards and reports with a strong focus on storytelling, making complex data easy to understand for stakeholders
Strategic Impact: Partner with stakeholders to align data strategies with business goals, support roadmap decisions, and ensure appropriate tracking is in place for new initiatives
Self-Service Analytics:Champion a self-service analytics culture across the organization, empowering teams to access, interpret, and utilize data independently
Education & Communication: Lead and participate in data education initiatives to improve understanding and utilization of data tools and methodologies across the organization
Process Automation: Identify opportunities for automation in data tracking, analysis, and reporting to streamline processes and improve scalability
Documentation: Create standardized and accessible documentation to ensure clarity, reduce dependencies, and enable teams to operate autonomously


What We’re Looking For 

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following: 


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, demonstrating the ability to work independently and proactively drive change
Strong knowledge of SQL and proficiency in visualization tools like Tableau or ThoughtSpot
Expertise in data storytelling, with the ability to translate complex insights into clear, compelling presentations for technical and non-technical audiences
A passion for setting up dashboards, KPIs, and reporting structures that inspire action and align with business goals
A collaborative mindset, with the ability to build strong relationships and work cross-functionally
A proactive approach to problem-solving, actively seeking new solutions and considering scalability in your work
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for making others enthusiastic about data
Strong proficiency in Danish, both written and spoken


It’s a bonus if you have: 


Experience with analytical engineering or tools like Databricks
Background in the streaming or media industry


What we offer you


We’ve got you covered! 25 days + 5 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more. 


Hit play today 

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position. 

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

Hit play today 

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position. 

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.




👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy 💥




Your Responsibilities Will Include

Data Analysis & Visualization
Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
Collaboration & Strategy
Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
Team Development & Best Practices
Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.




🔎 About you

You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.




🎉 Our Perks

Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.




💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Show more
HTML:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.


👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy 💥


Your Responsibilities Will Include

  • Data Analysis & Visualization
  • Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
  • Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
  • Collaboration & Strategy
  • Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
  • Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
  • Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
  • You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
  • Team Development & Best Practices
  • Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
  • Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
  • Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.


🔎 About you

  • You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
  • You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
  • You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
  • You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
  • Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
  • You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.


🎉 Our Perks

  • Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
  • Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
  • Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
  • Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.


💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you’ll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
Show more

Title: Statistician
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 160 employees across more than 30 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

We are looking for an in-house statistician to assist our Programme and Data teams. Across both, we are looking to better understand and explain our data in order to bolster our scientific rigour. You will sit between both teams and should be confident working with different types of statistical analysis, process-based modelling, and sampling/stratification.

Equally, you should have a good understanding of statistical modelling and bring a fresh perspective to our machine learning and process-based approaches. Thus, you will be a strong communicator capable of translating complex analysis into simplified insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

The Programme and Data teams are integral to the scientific operations of the company, and you will work closely together with them and our Product teams to ensure state of the art science drives our world leading carbon platform. As such, you will be part of a dynamic and high-paced work environment constantly subject to innovation.

How Will You Make An Impact

  • Estimating uncertainty and error propagation in our models;
  • Applying Bayesian methods for the calibration of complex process-based models;
  • Designing sampling strategies for our data collection campaigns;
  • Evaluating the quality and quantity of our data;
  • Communicating and visualising key insights;

Who We’re Looking For

  • Self-driven individual capable of collaborating in a multi-disciplinary environment;
  • Minimum Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, or appropriate science/engineering field;
  • 3+ years of experience working in a relevant field, with experience in some or all of the following:
  • Statistical and data-sampling techniques such as regression, imputation, random forest, Monte Carlo, stratification, and/or clustering;
  • Working with temporal and spatial data;
  • Experience coding in R;
  • Strong scientific writing, report creation and communication skills to audiences with a range of technical expertise.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Masters or PhD in one of the relevant Science fields mentioned above;
  • A baseline understanding of greenhouse gas accounting frameworks and methodologies;
  • Strong theoretical background in Bayesian Statistics;
  • Knowledge or experience working with crop, pedometrics, or process-based models;
  • Experience coding in Python;
  • Handling unstructured/imbalanced data.

What’s In It For You

  • A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
  • A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
  • Competitive compensation package and holidays;
  • Centrally located modern office in Copenhagen or London and the option to work from home a couple days a week;
  • Team events throughout the year;
  • An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
  • Open communication and supportive feedback culture.

🌱 Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

🌍 Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.

Title: Data Analyst, Supply Chain
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Supply Chain analyst with focus on Data to support Operations and inventory management.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Other duties may be assigned.


Analyse business data to understand issues, trends, and patterns with a focus on product availability, improving the customer experience and cost reduction.
Identify issues, participate in the development and implementation of supply chain solutions, review data and determine how to solve problems and learn critical insights about our business.
Support Inventory strategy with the aim of controlling inventory value, analyze inventory turnover rate and reduce obsolescence.
Maintain accurate procedures for all inventory control processes and functions.
Build strong relationships with the team to identify and rectify key issues and challenges and provide analysis and insight that will add value to the team and wider business.
Develop, automate and generate frequently used KPI reports.
Improve existing reports and data for optimization within Operation. Support wider ops team with ad hoc tasks within the area of Purchasing, Sourcing and Manufacturing.
Build effective, accurate and value-adding reports and analytics.
Build dashboard in Power BI and Power point presentations.
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:
Degree in Information Systems, Supply Chain Management or related field.
Experience in strategic analysis, planning and logistic analytics.
Experience working in operations or supply chain management.
Excellent PC skills and systems knowledge. Super user in MS Excel (Macros), Oracle EBS, Agile.
Experience with Power BI, SQL and OBIEE.
Goal orientated with strong numerical and analytical skills.
With strong focus on the detail
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to organise and work to tight deadlines.
Flexible, innovative and creative in attitudes to all issues and areas of the business
Excellent team player and willing to interact with internal teams, suppliers and freight carriers.
LANGUAGE SKILLS:
Ability to read, analyse and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals and technical procedures. Ability to write reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers and the general public.
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, percentages, area, circumference and volume.
Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
REASONING ABILITY:
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear.
The employee is regularly required to work at a keyboard and computer.
The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Work environment could include the following:
Airports
Home office
Driving in Traffic
Riding with District Sales Manger
Driving in adverse weather i.e. rain, snow, sleet
Hotels

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Research Analyst

Location: Aarhus, Denmark or Hamburg, Germany | Employment Type: Full-time




Join Our Team

Be at the forefront of the global energy transition! At Brinckmann Group, we are passionate about enabling businesses to navigate the rapidly evolving renewable energy sector profitably. As a Research Analyst, you will play a key role in delivering data-driven insights and empowering solutions that accelerate decarbonization worldwide. 




From our Aarhus and Hamburg offices, our team delivers world-class advisory services, spanning wind power, solar PV, and green hydrogen. Since our founding in 2018, Brinckmann has earned recognition as a trusted partner to leading renewable energy players, offering strategic insights and tailored advice to help them thrive in this rapidly growing industry.




Role Overview 

We are looking for a driven Research Analyst to join our team in Aarhus, Denmark. This role offers extensive opportunities to engage in cutting-edge renewable energy research, develop advanced analytical models, and expand your expertise as part of an agile, international team.  




Key responsibilities include:

Conduct both primary and secondary research focusing on the global Wind and Power-to-X (PtX) markets.
Develop analytical models to forecast market trends and analyze the Wind and PtX value chain.
Ensure continuous improvement in data quality and accuracy.
Prepare detailed reports and presentations for publication.
Support client consulting engagements by providing expertise in renewable energy.
Stay updated on industry trends, market dynamics, and policy changes.
Represent Brinckmann at conferences and industry events, helping to grow both personal and organizational networks.




Candidate Profile

We are seeking a motivated individual with a passion for renewable energy and a strong research mindset. The ideal candidate will:

Hold a Master's degree or equivalent in Business, Economics, Finance, Renewable Energy, or a related field.
Demonstrate expertise in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to derive meaningful insights for decision-making.
Have professional knowledge of the wind energy industry, ideally with some direct experience (a minimum of 2 years is desirable but not required).
Be skilled in organizing and analyzing data for insights, with proficiency in tools such as Excel and Microsoft Office (PowerPoint and Word). Knowledge of other data processing and analysis tools, including AI, is valued. 
Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills, producing reports and presentations suited to different audiences.
Be a team player, capable of collaborating effectively under deadlines in a professional environment.
Bring curiosity, adaptability, and integrity to the role, ensuring client and company interests remain the priority. 
Demonstrate strong interpersonal and networking skills




What We Offer

The chance to develop deep industry expertise within the rapidly evolving energy transition sector.
A dynamic, open work environment built on our core values of professionalism, integrity, value creation, and co-creation.
Opportunities for personal development and a competitive salary tailored to your qualifications.
Commitment to work-life balance, inclusive culture, and comprehensive employee support and perks.




About Brinckmann Group

At Brinckmann, we are committed to accelerating decarbonization by helping businesses strategize, assess risks, and unlock growth opportunities. Our expert team, backed by comprehensive in-house databases and a trusted professional network, delivers actionable insights across the entire lifecycle of renewable energy infrastructure. We take pride in driving positive change and supporting a sustainable future for generations to come.




Application Process

Interested candidates are invited to apply via LinkedIn as soon as possible. Applications are reviewed upon receipt. For further details or inquiries, contact Eliane Choquette, Research Practice Lead, at ech@brinckmanngroup.com or +45 5455 8655.




Please note that this position is open only to residents of Denmark or Germany.




Discover more about Brinckmann and this opportunity at www.brinckmanngroup.com

Title: Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for a Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Reporting & insights, trend visualization, AI modelling, performance analysis
Responsible for the preparation, extrapolation and analysis of product and market
Analyze product / aftersales performance based on specific reports (price position, trends, competitors' actions)
Frequent reporting of campaign performance
Media KPIs (GRP, reach, impressions, clicks, CPC)
Number of qualified visitors, cost per QVs
Showroom traffic
Captive bank data analysis based on request
Supervise and monitor quarterly and seasonal campaigns & action plans, execution of European Aftersales marketing strategies and programs, webpage development
Review AS campaign data and evaluate the results of the performed campaign, lead strategic direction for future campaigns
Ensure sufficient training (internal) for reporting
Control budget related to the dealer data and systems
Managing special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national management


What we look for:


Minimum 5 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus
Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous
Experience in Data management / engineering
Higher education at Bachelors' level
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage
Analytical skills
Advanced PC skills
Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
Presentation skills
Data-driven decision-making
Borderless and virtual mindset
Ability to simplify
Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Data Model Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
GS1 Denmark søger en Data Model Specialist til vores digitale services.




Brænder du for datamodellering og at sikre høj datakvalitet? Vil du være med til at udvikle og vedligeholde datamodeller, der understøtter digitale løsninger for både danske og internationale virksomheder? Så har vi jobbet til dig!




Hos GS1 Denmark søger vi en Data Model Specialist, der vil få ansvar for vores datamodeller til services som GS1Trade Sync, GS1Trade Exact og GS1Trade Activate. Vi tilbyder et spændende job i en international organisation, hvor dine kompetencer og ambitioner kan være med til at sætte standarder for fremtidens handel og samarbejde.




Om rollen

Som Data Model Specialist bliver du ansvarlig for at:

Udvikle, vedligeholde og optimere datamodeller til vores services.
Sikre, at datamodellerne understøtter forretningsbehov og internationale standarder.
Samarbejde med vores kunder og partnere for at forstå og implementere deres krav.
Bidrage til at udvikle nye digitale løsninger baseret på GS1-standarder.
Sikre dokumentation og vidensdeling på tværs af organisationen.




Vi forestiller os, at du

Har erfaring med datamodellering og dataanalyse.
Kender til dataudvekslingsstandarder og systemintegration – kendskab til GS1-standarder er en fordel, men ikke et krav.
Har stærke analytiske evner samt at du er detaljeorienteret.
Trives i en rolle med både selvstændigt ansvar og samarbejde på tværs af teams.
Har gode kommunikationsevner på dansk og engelsk.




Vi tilbyder

En spændende stilling i en organisation med stor impact på handel og logistik.
Et internationalt miljø med dygtige og engagerede kolleger.
Mulighed for faglig og personlig udvikling.
En arbejdsplads, hvor innovation og samarbejde er i fokus.




Ansøgning

Peoplematter A/S hjælper os med rekrutteringen. Der afholdes samtaler løbende og vi lukker stillingen, når den rette kandidat er fundet. Ansøgning og CV sendes til so@peoplematter.dk i ét dokument. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Søren Overbeck på tlf. +45 22 80 96 84.




Om GS1

GS1 Denmark er den danske division af den globale standardiseringsorganisation GS1. Vi støtter aktører i forsyningskæden og øger effektiviteten, sikkerheden og reducerer omkostningerne. Vi opererer primært inden for detailhandlen og sundhedssektoren med fokus på sporbarhed og data for at øge sikkerheden i Danmark. GS1 er en neutral, non-profit, FN-godkendt NGO.




For yderligere information se mere på www.gs1.dk og www.gs1.org eller ring til Søren Overbeck på ovennævnte telefonnummer.
