Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Customer Insights Analyst hos 3
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Som Customer Insights Analyst bliver du en del vores analyseteam på 3 personer inkl. dig, der leverer kundeindsigter til både 3’s privat- og erhvervsforretning. Vi arbejder tæt sammen med både marketing, produktudvikling, CX og digital for at forstå forretningens behov og understøtte med relevante kundeindsigter. Nogle undersøgelser opstår på teamets eget initiativ og andre ud fra en bestilling fra forretningen.

Dine primære opgaver vil være:


Drive nye kunde- og markedsundersøgelser fra start til slut - lige fra at identificere og forstå forretningsbehovet, definere metodologien, koordinere dataindsamlingen og analysere resultaterne.
Udarbejde rapporter og præsentationer med klare anbefalinger og konklusioner samt præsentere dine indsigter for relevante stakeholders.
Udvikle og analysere på vores eksisterende kundetilfredshedsmålinger for at forstå kundernes behov og identificere muligheder for forbedring af kundeoplevelsen.
Være en ambassadør for kundeindsigter på tværs af de kommercielle afdelinger og hjælpe dine kolleger med at identificere nye behov for kundeundersøgelser.


Hvem er du?

Vi er åbne overfor forskellige profiler, men forestiller os at du kan nikke genkendende til størstedelen af disse punkter:


Du har en kandidatgrad inden for fx marketing, erhvervsøkonomi eller lignende.
Du har minimum 2 års erfaring med dataanalyse og kundeindsigter, fx fra et analysebureau eller en lignende rolle i en større organisation.
Du har en stærk analytisk sans og en god forståelse for både kvantitative og kvalitative research metodologier samt basal statistik.
Du trives med at fordybe dig i data og arbejder selvsikkert i Excel med både databehandling, -analyse og -visualisering. Hvis du har erfaring med SurveyXact er det også et plus.
Du er en skarp formidler og god til at omdanne komplekse data til enkle og klare PowerPoint slides med konklusioner og anbefalinger.
Du får energi fra at hjælpe andre med at få de rette indsigter og er oprigtigt nysgerrig på at forstå vores kunder, konkurrenter og marked.


Hvad kan du forvente hos 3?

Hos 3 får du billet til et fællesskab bestående af 700 dygtige medarbejdere, som er dedikerede i en sjælden grad. Du får din daglige gang på vores hovedkontor i Carlsberg Byen, der er præget af mangfoldighed og mange forskellige personligheder samt en hverdag fyldt med både humor og ambitioner. Vi har – ligesom dig – gejst og viljen til at lykkes, og vi har både plads til forskellighed og store drømme. Vi tilbyder gode udviklingsmuligheder og medarbejderfordele, og så mener vi selv at have landets lækreste frokostordning.

Ansøgning og kontakt

Har du lyst til at blive en del af 3, så send din ansøgning og dit CV hurtigst muligt – vi afholder løbende samtaler, indtil vi har fundet den rette kandidat. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, så kontakt Manager - Customer & Market Insights, Christina Haagh, på 31 200 532.
Show more

Title: Student Assistant to join our in-house Analysis team
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you nerdy about analyses and assessments?
We are looking for a motivated student to join our dynamic Analysis Team. In this role, you will mainly be supporting our test centre in managing various assessment tool projects. You will focus on projects involving a range of personality assessments and will collaborate with another student to handle tasks in this area. This role requires someone who enjoys both independent work and effective collaboration to ensure smooth project handovers.

What you will do


Setting up and distributing various personality assessments
Creating timelines for small projects
Providing guidance and support to colleagues and clients regarding tools and theory
Ad-hoc assignments


What you will bring

We are looking for a new colleague who:


Is currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Has an interest in social sciences and thrives in a fast-paced, energetic environment
Is proficient in Microsoft Outlook and Excel
Is fluent in Danish and English, both written and spoken
Is structured, organised, and capable of managing projects independently
Is service-minded and a great team player


What we offer

We offer a position in a leading consultancy where you will be responsible for supporting various quantitative projects and administrative tasks. You will become part of our fantastic Analysis Team, dedicated to surveys, insights, and quantitative analysis. The role is approximately 15 hours per week
. However, we also understand that you must attend to and prioritise your studies, and we recognise that there will be times when you are occupied with exams.

You will also have excellent development opportunities
within quantitative data management and analysis among highly competent and ambitious colleagues. We operate with a high degree of freedom
and responsibility,
supporting each other in our efforts to constantly improve how we help our clients and colleagues achieve exceptional results.

About Implement

Implement Consulting Group is an international management consulting firm with 1,800+ employees and an annual growth rate of 20%. Headquartered in Copenhagen, we have offices across the Nordics, the DACH region, and the US. We help leading organisations succeed with their most critical change initiatives by unlocking human and business potential – in that order.

Our goal is to be the best place for the best people
. Beyond great benefits, training, and amazing meals (breakfast, lunch and dinner every day!), we are home to vibrant communities for expats, LGBTQ+ members, and much more. You’ll also find running clubs, Friday football, cultural explorations, unforgettable parties and Friday bars, and offsites. And that’s just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to life at Implement.

For further information about the position, please contact Charlotte Kirk at cki@implement.dk. For further information about the recruitment process, please contact our Talent Attraction team at talent_attraction@implement.dk

The application deadline is Sunday the 30th of March, and we will conduct interviews shortly after.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the “Team Data Science Process” or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, by phone at +45 31624481.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you someone who takes ownership of tasks, sees projects through with focus, and thrives on creative problem-solving? Do you enjoy uncovering patterns in data and transforming insights into actionable solutions? If you're motivated by continuous improvement and strategic thinking, this might be the perfect opportunity for you.

At PriceShape, we value collaboration and the drive to contribute to meaningful advancements. You’ll bring structure to complex problems and communicate findings to inspire action, all while contributing to the evolution of our technology and e-commerce platform.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist at PriceShape, you will play an essential role in analyzing, modeling, and deriving insights from data that drives our platform's core functionalities. You will focus on building predictive models, analyzing trends, and optimizing e-commerce-related processes using structured data.

Your day-to-day work will be together with an international team, working closely with your Team Lead, our CTO, Head of Engineering and our full-stack developers. Our department consists of colleagues from various parts of the world and English is the primary language for communication.

Your Key Responsibilities Consist Of The Following


Supporting the development and deployment of machine learning and deep learning models, contributing to the process from ideation to implementation under the guidance of the team lead.
Assisting in advanced time series analyses for e-commerce data, such as sales forecasting and inventory management.
Writing and optimizing complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data.
Collaborating with software developers to implement data-driven solutions into the platform.
Conducting exploratory data analysis and presenting insights to the team lead and relevant stakeholders.


We Expect You To Bring The Following

Your hands-on skills and data curiosity are what matter most. We're looking for someone who is self-sufficient, eager to learn, and most importantly someone who is passionate about data science within the e-commerce space.

Must-Have Skills


Strong experience with Python and relevant libraries (e.g., Pandas, Numpy, Scikit learn, TensorFlow…).
Proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex queries involving joins, subqueries, and aggregations.
A solid understanding of machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning) and their practical applications in sales data.
Practical experience in time series analysis for solving business problems like sales forecasting and inventory management.
Experience deploying and maintaining machine learning models in a production environment using AWS services.
Strong understanding of feature engineering techniques.
Experience with software engineering best practices such as version control and testing.


Good-to-Have Skills


Familiarity with working on sales and customer data in e-commerce.
Ability to quickly understand e-commerce-specific datasets and use them effectively
Basic knowledge of deep learning, particularly LSTMs (Long Short-Term Memory networks).


What You Can Expect From Us


A great career opportunity for continuous growth alongside your team and the company.
An informal, international startup culture that prioritizes work-life balance.
Flexible working hours, with a base at our new office in Aarhus C.
Computer and equipment of your choice.
Social events like parties, poker nights, and padel tennis.


About PriceShape

PriceShape is a fast-growing company with potential for personal and professional growth. We are a young SaaS company that develops and sells a price optimization tool for e-commerce stores and brands worldwide. PriceShape has around 95 employees with our daily operations in Aarhus.

How To Apply

If you think the position is attractive and suitable, please send us a job application and your CV as soon as possible. We process and interview on an ongoing basis. For clarifications about the position, you can contact our CTO, Brian Hansen at brha@priceshape.dk.

Title: VIE - Data Analyst, Denmark, Engesvang
Description:
How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

Specialty Gases is a team of 7 experienced colleagues with different ages and gender. We work between 7:00-16:00 producing different mixtures every day were no day is as the previous one. The laboratory is a team of 3 experienced women with good routines and procedures. We work very close together and enjoy the work as well as the breaks.

The goal is to achieve an accreditation for ISO 17025 (Laboratory) & ISO 17034 (Specialty Gases) to provide a better variety of products with shorter leadtimes to our customers in the Nordics. This is important for Air Liquide to achieve profitable growth in the Nordics.

You will be the project manager on this way ensuring that we will stay on track, use our resources in the best way and bring the results and stakeholders together to achieve the goal. The main interactions will take place with the specialty gas team and the laboratory as well as the accreditation body but also colleagues and experts in Europe. The project will benefit from the experience of other plants in europe that already have achieved the accrediation.

The mission requires very good English communication skills in both verbal and writing with people at various level internally as well as externally.

___________________

Are you a MATCH?

Educational Qualifications:


Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a specialization in chemistry, physics, mathematics, or similar disciplines.



Essential Skills and Competencies:


Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
Strong sense of responsibility, open-mindedness, and a results-driven mindset.
Highly motivated and committed to achieving project goals.
Proficient in uncertainty calculations and preparation of official reports.
Advanced skills in Google Sheets for data analysis and reporting.



Nice to have:


Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders
Proven experience in project planning and leadership.
Expertise in data evaluation and analysis.
Familiarity with accreditation processes and standards.



Language:


Fluency in English (both written and spoken).
Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Norwegian, Danish, or Swedish) is advantageous



Please send the CV and cover letter in English.

Position open only for candidates eligible to the VIE program. Therefore, only the applicants meeting the requirements of the French V.I.E program will be taken into consideration. Please visit this website for more information about these requirements

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en/what-is-the-vie-french-international-internship-program

The V.I.E., an international young graduate program, enables young professionals who are less than 28 and European Union nationals to work for a French company in any country of the world. Becoming part of this program means going abroad to carry out a professional assignment for up to 24 months whilst benefiting from social care coverage and an interesting salary, which depends on the host country.

Business France, the French agency for international business development, is in charge of all the administrative procedures of your assignment. For further information, please visit the following link:

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en

Our Differences make our Performance

At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.

We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.
Show more
HTML:
How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

Specialty Gases is a team of 7 experienced colleagues with different ages and gender. We work between 7:00-16:00 producing different mixtures every day were no day is as the previous one. The laboratory is a team of 3 experienced women with good routines and procedures. We work very close together and enjoy the work as well as the breaks.

The goal is to achieve an accreditation for ISO 17025 (Laboratory) & ISO 17034 (Specialty Gases) to provide a better variety of products with shorter leadtimes to our customers in the Nordics. This is important for Air Liquide to achieve profitable growth in the Nordics.

You will be the project manager on this way ensuring that we will stay on track, use our resources in the best way and bring the results and stakeholders together to achieve the goal. The main interactions will take place with the specialty gas team and the laboratory as well as the accreditation body but also colleagues and experts in Europe. The project will benefit from the experience of other plants in europe that already have achieved the accrediation.

The mission requires very good English communication skills in both verbal and writing with people at various level internally as well as externally.

___________________

Are you a MATCH?

Educational Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a specialization in chemistry, physics, mathematics, or similar disciplines.


Essential Skills and Competencies:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
  • Strong sense of responsibility, open-mindedness, and a results-driven mindset.
  • Highly motivated and committed to achieving project goals.
  • Proficient in uncertainty calculations and preparation of official reports.
  • Advanced skills in Google Sheets for data analysis and reporting.


Nice to have:

  • Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders
  • Proven experience in project planning and leadership.
  • Expertise in data evaluation and analysis.
  • Familiarity with accreditation processes and standards.


Language:

  • Fluency in English (both written and spoken).
  • Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Norwegian, Danish, or Swedish) is advantageous


Please send the CV and cover letter in English.

Position open only for candidates eligible to the VIE program. Therefore, only the applicants meeting the requirements of the French V.I.E program will be taken into consideration. Please visit this website for more information about these requirements

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en/what-is-the-vie-french-international-internship-program

The V.I.E., an international young graduate program, enables young professionals who are less than 28 and European Union nationals to work for a French company in any country of the world. Becoming part of this program means going abroad to carry out a professional assignment for up to 24 months whilst benefiting from social care coverage and an interesting salary, which depends on the host country.

Business France, the French agency for international business development, is in charge of all the administrative procedures of your assignment. For further information, please visit the following link:

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en

Our Differences make our Performance

At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.

We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist




Location: Copenhagen

Job Type: full-time




HELP ORGANIZATIONS WORLDWIDE TO REALIZE THE POTENTIAL OF AI WITH OUR AI PLATFORM, GRACE




Are you a highly ambitious and motivated Data Scientist interested in positively impacting the world with AI technology that you develop and deliver to clients worldwide?  If so, you might be the new colleague we at 2021.AI are looking for! 




2021.AI seeks a motivated Data Scientist to join our highly-skilled team of Data Scientists, working at the forefront of solving business challenges using statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering, etc.. In this role, you will participate in data science projects and deliveries. In addition, you will assist in the future development of different AI / ML and technology services on our GRACE platform. 




About You




You have high ambitions and want to positively impact the world with the AI / ML technology you develop and deliver to clients globally. This shines through in your ability to use statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering skills to deliver impactful and valuable business solutions across different industries in the private and public sectors.




You are independent, driven, motivated, and solution-oriented.




You work well with others. This entails teamwork with your internal team and with clients on- and off-site.




Your expertise is with data science, AI/ML, and related technologies, and you are passionate about delivering AI/ML solutions all the way from initial ML model research to implementing the working model in production. 




You have experience in independently developing AI/ML, or statistical models or LLMs that solve particular business challenges, including the process of preparing the models for deployment and production.




You are interested in working with one of the best data science teams on the planet, technology rock stars, and business magnates, all dedicated to responsibly and positively impacting the future with AI. 




About the Role




As a Data Scientist at 2021.AI, you will make your mark and directly influence the direction of data science in 2021.AI while delivering value with AI and ML to our partners and clients. 




You will participate as a Data Scientist in client projects and work closely with other teams in 2021.AI to improve our core product features, and demonstrate product value to clients on the GRACE Platform.




Key Responsibilities

Take part in projects developing AI and ML models for clients and partners
Embed those actions and insights into integrations and solutions for our clients’ businesses
Develop high-quality models with the business value behind in mind
Bring business objectives to the center of the ML development process




Skills and Qualifications:




M.Sc. or equivalent in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
2-3 years of hands-on, practical experience
Solid experience in Python programming combined with a mathematical/theoretical foundation in statistical modeling
Experience in writing production ready Python code
Data manipulation and visualization skills, including database handling and data cleaning/management
ML Engineering experience related to implementation and deployment of  AI and ML into production via, e.g. Flask, FastAPI or Docker
Knowledge in LLMs including  RAG construction and prompt engineering
Full working knowledge of English
Fast learning and a proactive mindset
Excellent presentation skills both toward business leaders and technical experts
Exceptional human and superb collaboration skills




Extra consideration is given to candidates with: 




The ability to identify potential use cases to create business value for our customers




About 2021.AI 




Founded in Copenhagen with several offices worldwide, 2021.AI is a fast-growing AI company focused on closing the gap between AI ambitions and real AI value for companies worldwide. Large private and public organizations globally trust us to help them stay competitive, compliant, and in control when applying AI. 




We are a team of passionate people who care deeply about the mission we are on; to positively impact the future with AI. Our tight-knit culture of camaraderie instills more than just a sense of belonging but great pride in our work. With high cultural ambitions, we expect you to bring lots of energy to the workplace and participate in company-related and social activities. In return, we promise great professional experiences and the freedom to tackle and own your tasks.




Supporting you professionally and personally

Professional Growth: Your CV will tell us where you've been, but we are also interested in where you want to go. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. We trust our team members and give them autonomy to do their best work. We also support professional development and provide regular feedback.
Meaningful Impact: In our company, every job matters, and you can see almost daily that you are making a meaningful impact. Our feedback loops are fast, which means you will have the opportunity to learn and advance quickly, growing together with the company. 
Outstanding Team: Our AI platform GRACE helps companies and people cooperate across the board, and we apply this mindset to our own team. We have a highly collaborative, no-bureaucracy culture. 
Excellent Benefits: We offer competitive pay, a healthcare benefits package, and a positive work-life balance.
For Copenhagen employees, we provide the corporate equipment you need, flexible working hours, team buildings, a fantastic office location in Nørrebro, Friday bars, coffee, laughs, and cutting-edge industry knowledge!







Useful links to get to know us better:




2021.AI video introduction
Company brochure
 AI Platform brochure
Client cases page




2021.AI is an equal opportunity company. We welcome all applicants no matter their race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, criminal prosecution, judgment in a criminal case, or any other characteristic protected by law.




Questions & Support? Let’s connect. Please contact us: careers@2021.ai

Title: Consultant / Senior Consultant – Data & Analytics
Description:
Are you passionate about helping leading companies to harness their data to become data-driven? Does consulting and solving challenging business problems appeal to you? Do you thrive in a collaborative, entrepreneurial, and supportive work culture?




Then join our growing consulting team in Copenhagen!




At BearingPoint Denmark, you’ll join an environment that brings together the best of both worlds—the agility of a fast-growing practice and the resources of a global consultancy. Since opening our Copenhagen office in 2021, we’ve built a team of 10+ professionals, working from a brand-new office in the heart of the city.




As we continue growing our business and team, you’ll have the chance to work with Denmark’s leading companies and collaborate with our international teams across the Nordics and beyond. We foster a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment where everyone plays a role in our shared success, shaping both our team’s future and that of our clients.




Your role:

As a Data & Analytics Consultant / Senior Consultant, you’ll deliver insights from data into concrete processes and decisions to create value for the customer. Working alongside our AI Lead in Denmark and collaborating with our Nordic team, you will for example:

Implement analytics solutions, to predict risks or perform simulations of financial scenarios, and forecast trends to improve our clients’ performance and profitability.

Deliver insights using machine learning models, static analyzes and optimization methods.
Conduct experiments, ensure that they are carried out correctly and analyzing the results.
Visualize and present data in an actionable and clear manner using tools like Power BI to support decision-making.
Contribute to business development, including creating client proposals, identifying opportunities, and developing our offerings and internal practices.




As your expertise grows, you'll take on bigger responsibilities—leading projects or project streams, working closely with clients, and driving business growth. Throughout the recruitment process, we’ll shape the role to match your expertise and experience, ensuring the best fit for all.




We are looking for:

A few years of prior experience in working with data (f.ex. as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, consulting role or similar)
Analytical skills, such as mathematical modeling and statistical analysis
Proficiency in programming languages like Python
Experience with visualizing data (f.ex. Power BI, Tableau) and large datasets using SQL
Knowledge of and/or experience with relevant cloud technologies
Academic degree in a relevant field (for example computer science, data science, business analytics or related field)
Fluent communication skills in Danish and English, both written and spoken




As an advantage we see:

Experience in the financial sector or analytics, such as credit risk modeling, financial crime prevention, segmentation, or customer profiling
Previous client-facing role




In addition, we’re looking for strong problem-solving skills, proactive mindset and curiosity to learn. We hope you are a true team player, as collaboration is an essential part of our culture. An entrepreneurial mentality and commitment to contribute to developing our practice in Denmark will take you far in this role.




What you can expect:

Joining us isn’t just about the job—it’s about the opportunities, the people, and the impact you’ll have. Here’s what you can expect:




Steep learning curve & interesting projects: You’ll have the chance to work with leading-edge solutions and continuously develop your skillset as you work with diverse client projects together with a team of consultants. We have a vibrant global data & analytics community within the company to share and deepen your knowledge and collaborate with.
Entrepreneurial spirit and people-centric growth – We embrace an entrepreneurial mindset where dedication and teamwork are keys to our success. As a new practice with ambitious growth targets, we are committed to making our mark by building strong brand awareness through a people-centric approach.
Commitment and quality – We value those who actively contribute to shaping an environment where everyone is seen, heard, and engaged. With a long-term commitment and a dedication to quality in everything we do, we are creating something lasting—for our clients, our team, and our workplace.
Professional & personal growth – We invest in our people. Through regular discussions with your development manager, formal trainings and hands-on project work, we’ll support your personal and professional development every step of the way.
Competitive salary, benefits & flexible work options – We offer a competitive salary and benefits, along with hybrid working options to promote a healthy work-life balance. Our centrally located office offers a dynamic space for focus, collaboration, and connection.




If this sounds like the next step in your career, join us at BearingPoint!




We are looking forward to receiving your application by Monday 31st of March. For more information, please contact Sara Lyng (+45 29 91 68 92) during office hours. We review applications and may start the process before the deadline—so don’t wait to apply! This is a permanent full-time position.




BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer. We’re all about helping people reach their full potential, and we know that the best ideas come from different perspectives and experiences. To learn more about us, you can visit www.bearingpoint.com, and follow our latest news on LinkedIn.




About BearingPoint

BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. The company operates in three business units: Consulting, Products, and Capital. Consulting covers advisory business with a clear focus on selected business areas. Products provides IP-driven digital assets and managed services for business-critical processes. Capital delivers M&A and transaction services. BearingPoint's clients include many of the world's leading companies and organizations. The firm has a global consulting network with more than 13,000 people and supports clients in over 70 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.




We are guided by our purpose – Together, we are more than business.




It revolves around three key focus areas – More innovation, More for our planet, and More for our people. To make sure we live that purpose, we’re steered by a set of values that bring our purpose to life and are the essence of our culture – We are easy to work with, We create lasting outcomes, We empower people to succeed. We are a strongly purpose & values-driven organization, both today and as we forge our way into the future. Learn more about our purpose and values here. BearingPoint is a certified B Corporation, meeting high standards of social and environmental impact.

Title: Migration Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Introduction & Summary

emagine is seeking an experienced freelance IT consultant to join one of our clients in the pharmaceutical industry as Migration Data Analysts. This role is essential for understanding and implementing master data requirements while engaging with various stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a thorough understanding of data processes to excel in this position.

Main Responsibilities

The Migration Data Analyst will take the lead in analyzing business contexts and ensuring the proper setup of master data. You will:


Conduct business context analysis to understand site-specific master data needs.
Set up relevant master data configurations in the solution.
Engage stakeholders to gather Line of Business (LoB) requirements and suggest process improvements.
Support WareX product analysts in master data efforts throughout projects.
Participate in testing and developing new tools for mass creation or modification of master data.
Collaborate with site-specific stakeholders, such as LoB MD Stewards, to address requirements and concerns.
Create and maintain standard master data approaches in WareX deployments.
Identify and resolve data-related issues efficiently.
Provide training and support to relevant users.
Continuously seek improvements in data management processes.


Key Requirements


Proven experience in master data management.
Strong understanding of IT processes, particularly data processes.
Comprehensive end-to-end process knowledge.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality assurance.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and collaboration skills.
Ability to drive process improvements effectively.
Experience in documentation and training.


Nice to Have


Familiarity with data migration tools.
Project management experience.
Knowledge of industry-specific master data standards.


Location: Bagsværd, Copenhagen

Allocation: 100%

Start date: 1st of April

Duration: 12 months with possibility of extension

Title: Azure løsningsarkitekt
Description:
Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?




Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt




Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.




Andre ansvarsområder:

Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen




Dine kompetencer:

5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter




Om dig:

Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater




En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester




Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens førende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.




Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt særligt – og det er det vi elsker ved at være medarbejdere i Crayon.




At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.




If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

HTML:
• Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
  • Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
  • Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?


Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt


Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.


Andre ansvarsområder:

  • Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
  • Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
  • Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
  • Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen


Dine kompetencer:

  • 5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
  • Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
  • Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
  • Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
  • Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
  • Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter


Om dig:

  • Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
  • Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
  • Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater

Title: Student Assistant AI
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a student skilled in AI ready to apply your knowledge of AI and software development in a real-world setting?

Become a part of our AI and Innovation team, where we develop innovative AI solutions that reshape our interaction with technology. Our aim? To Bring People Closer through AI-driven innovation—and we want you to be part of it!

The Team You Will be Part of

Join an innovative and inclusive AI and Innovation team that thrives on collaboration and creativity! Our team consists of a collaborative group of innovative thinkers focused on providing valuable AI solutions. We believe that diverse perspectives fuel innovation, and we encourage every team member to share their ideas and insights. Together, we create a space that honors every voice, allowing everyone to engage in our collective effort to transform the way we interact with technology through AI. This position allows you to learn from knowledgeable experts and work with peers who also value the evolving landscape of AI!

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:


Develop AI Solutions: Assist in designing, coding, and testing AI applications and software tools.
Experiment & Innovate: Work with machine learning models, data processing pipelines, and automation tools.
Collaborate & Learn: Participate in brainstorming sessions, team discussions, and code reviews.
Optimize & Improve: Advance system performance, scalability, and AI model accuracy.


To fulfill your responsibilities in the role, we imagine that you:


Are currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field, with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence.
Have experience with Python, Java, or similar programming languages and an understanding of AI/ML frameworks.
Are interested in AI and its real-world applications.
Are motivated, adaptable, and willing to explore—you enjoy solving problems and experimenting with new technologies in collaboration with others.


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we warmly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value the right mindset. We consider that personal capabilities are vital for contributing to valuable results.

We prioritize creating an inclusive recruitment experience where every candidate is valued equally in the hiring process.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We support people with hearing loss to overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses, and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiasts.

Joining GN as a Student Assistant

In GN, our Student Assistants typically work 15-20 hours a week. We value flexibility and will collaborate with you to ensure your working hours complement your studies.

You also have the possibility to join the GN Students Network. This expansive network connects students from various departments and frequently hosts events like Friday happy hours, student lunches, and other engaging social activities.

How to apply?

To apply, use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 23rd of April, 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

Quick apply

You are welcome to use our Quick Apply function, where you only submit your up to date CV, including a few sentences outlining you motivation for applying – quick and easy.

We encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger on trgoenfeldtsenger@gn.com.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Web Analyst Intern
Description:
Are you eager to learn about and work with the latest technology in web analytics within an international company operating across 28 markets?




If yes, we are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Web Analyst Intern to join our UX and Insights team.




JYSK is in constant growth, and the same applies to our UX and Insights department. We have an increasing strategic focus on online data and insights and are always looking for new talents.




WHAT WE OFFER YOU

As a Web Analyst Intern, you will get a unique opportunity to develop your analytical skills and gain hands-on experience with advanced web analytics tools – primarily Google Analytics 4 (GA4).




In the Autumn of 2025, we offer a 4-6 months internship, where you will become an integral part of our UX and Insights team. Our expert in web analytics and data tracking will guide you and share their methodologies, helping you grow into a skilled web analyst.




You will have the chance to work independently on your own projects and contribute to the development of data-driven insights.




WHAT YOUR INTERNSHIP WILL BE ABOUT

Your tasks and responsibilities will include:

analysing user behavior and traffic data to optimize conversions and online performance
preparing reports that provide insights into our online performance
collaborating with internal teams on data analysis projects
identifying opportunities to improve our digital customer experience based on data




You can read more about our department here.




WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING

We are looking for an intern who:

is currently studying E-commerce, IT, Business Analytics, or related fields
has a strong interest in web analytics and digital user data, particularly with a focus on GA4
works independently and thrives in a dynamic and busy work environment
is detail-oriented and has a structured approach to tasks
has experience with or interest in tools like Google Tag Manager, GA4, and Excel
is fluent in English




IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Senior Web Analyst, Thomas Lykke Sørensen, at +45 3125 4474.




Send us a short application along with your CV by clicking on “Apply.” We process applications on an ongoing basis and will close the recruitment process once we have found the right candidate.

The internship is set to start the 18th of August.




We offer flexibility to make sure you obtain the required 30 ECTS by attending an extra course during the semester or flexibility to prioritise writing days.




ABOUT US

We believe our employees are key to our success. That is why we strive to offer development and possibilities of growing and finding new challenges within JYSK. Since our founder, Lars Larsen, opened his first store in Denmark in 1979, JYSK has expanded our global presence with stores and web shops in countries around the world.




Our three fundamental JYSK Values – Tradesman, Colleague and Corporate Spirit – express the behavior and attitude that we can expect from each other. We trust each other, and we believe in Empowerment and freedom with responsibility. We also take pride in rewarding engagement and a great effort among our employees. With the right attitude, opportunities abound in JYSK.




JYSK wants to include everyone, no matter the age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and experience. Together, we secure our inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. Because a great mix of minds, talents and unique personalities makes us a stronger team.




For more information, please visit our career page.

Title: Senior Martech & Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

We’re looking for an exceptional Martech and Data Specialist to join the growing Data and Analytics Team at Too Good To Go.

Your mission

We are looking for a technically skilled and data-driven individual to enhance our digital marketing analytics capabilities. This role is critical in optimizing our tools, processes, and data infrastructure, enabling actionable insights and driving data-informed decision-making. You will play a key role in helping to advance attribution models, improving data quality, and supporting marketing performance metrics.

Your ultimate goal is to scale our digital marketing efforts and make Too Good To Go the #1 solution against Food Waste globally.

Your role


Maintain marketing tools and Infrastructure to ensure the highest standards of data quality and completeness.
Lead and manage cross-functional tool integration projects with Product, Tech, and Marketing teams, to design and implement a seamless, end-to-end data pipeline that integrates web and mobile platforms. Tools include web & product analytics platforms, mobile measurement platforms (e.g., Appsflyer), tag management and third-party integrations.
Support self-service analytics capabilities for the marketing team, help prioritize initiatives, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making to optimize spend and performance.
Lead efforts to enhance and optimize data used in attribution models, enabling deep insights into marketing spend performance and strategic decision-making.
Work closely with compliance teams to ensure marketing tools and practices adhere to GDPR, ePrivacy Directive and other relevant data regulations


Requirements


Full-stack & Technical Marketing Experience. With 5+ years in the industry and 3+ years in a similar role within a fast-paced environment, you bring a solid background in both full-stack and technical marketing.
SQL Proficiency. A strong command of SQL allows for efficient data extraction, manipulation, and transformation.
Infrastructure Scaling. Experienced in optimizing and scaling data pipelines, API integrations, app measurement platforms, and CRM tools (e.g., Braze, Salesforce, GTM, Appsflyer, Amplitude/Mixpanel).
Data Analytics & BI Tools. Expertise in cleaning, normalizing, and analyzing data, with the ability to present insights clearly using BI tools.
Tech-Savvy & Forward-Looking. Always up to date with advancements in marketing technology and analytics, identifying opportunities for innovation and performance improvement.
Proactive & Pragmatic Mindset. Passionate, hands-on, and autonomous, always taking the initiative to get the job done.
Rigorous & Focused. Efficient, precise, and quick to iterate in solving complex problems.
Team Player. A strong communicator who can bridge technical and non-technical teams, translating abstract ideas into measurable actions.
Eco-Conscious. Truly passionate about sustainability and fighting food waste, recognizing the urgency of change and action for the planet.
Perfectly Fluent in English. Full working proficiency in English, ensuring seamless communication and documentation.


Nice to have


Marketing Metrics. You have experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics.
Attribution Modeling. You have experience modelling attribution, especially for mobile applications
AB Testing Experience. You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

  • Maintain marketing tools and Infrastructure to ensure the highest standards of data quality and completeness.
  • Lead and manage cross-functional tool integration projects with Product, Tech, and Marketing teams, to design and implement a seamless, end-to-end data pipeline that integrates web and mobile platforms. Tools include web & product analytics platforms, mobile measurement platforms (e.g., Appsflyer), tag management and third-party integrations.
  • Support self-service analytics capabilities for the marketing team, help prioritize initiatives, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making to optimize spend and performance.
  • Lead efforts to enhance and optimize data used in attribution models, enabling deep insights into marketing spend performance and strategic decision-making.
  • Work closely with compliance teams to ensure marketing tools and practices adhere to GDPR, ePrivacy Directive and other relevant data regulations

Requirements

  • Full-stack & Technical Marketing Experience. With 5+ years in the industry and 3+ years in a similar role within a fast-paced environment, you bring a solid background in both full-stack and technical marketing.
  • SQL Proficiency. A strong command of SQL allows for efficient data extraction, manipulation, and transformation.
  • Infrastructure Scaling. Experienced in optimizing and scaling data pipelines, API integrations, app measurement platforms, and CRM tools (e.g., Braze, Salesforce, GTM, Appsflyer, Amplitude/Mixpanel).
  • Data Analytics & BI Tools. Expertise in cleaning, normalizing, and analyzing data, with the ability to present insights clearly using BI tools.
  • Tech-Savvy & Forward-Looking. Always up to date with advancements in marketing technology and analytics, identifying opportunities for innovation and performance improvement.
  • Proactive & Pragmatic Mindset. Passionate, hands-on, and autonomous, always taking the initiative to get the job done.
  • Rigorous & Focused. Efficient, precise, and quick to iterate in solving complex problems.
  • Team Player. A strong communicator who can bridge technical and non-technical teams, translating abstract ideas into measurable actions.
  • Eco-Conscious. Truly passionate about sustainability and fighting food waste, recognizing the urgency of change and action for the planet.
  • Perfectly Fluent in English. Full working proficiency in English, ensuring seamless communication and documentation.

Nice to have

  • Marketing Metrics. You have experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics.
  • Attribution Modeling. You have experience modelling attribution, especially for mobile applications
  • AB Testing Experience. You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests

Our values

  • We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
  • We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
  • We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
  • We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
  • We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

What We Have To Offer

  • An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
  • To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
  • Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
  • We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
  • To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
  • An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
  • We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
  • We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
  • We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.

How To Apply

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
As a Data Engineer in the Data Engineering Chapter, you will collaborate closely with diverse product teams across the business. Your role involves leveraging a range of cloud technologies and tools tailored to the specific data products you are working on.

Digital Solutions & Development > Digital Solutions > Chapter - Data Engineering #1

The Data Domains and Products, a vital part of Digital Solutions, is dedicated to delivering accurate, available, and comprehensive data products to enable actionable insights. This newly established area is an integral component of Vestas' innovative Digital Powerhouse. Our mission is to empower customers, partners, and colleagues to seamlessly discover, access, and connect essential information for informed decisions and impactful actions.

Responsibilities

Your key responsibilities will encompass:


Designing, constructing, and maintaining scalable, reliable, and efficient data products
Managing, enhancing and monitoring data products using DevOps methods
Supporting the enhancement of the common information model across the Vestas data landscape
Supporting the translation of logical models into reusable and reliable physical model
Engaging in close collaboration with the data platform team


Qualifications

We envision that you possess experience in designing, building, and maintaining data products within diverse cloud environments. Additionally, you should identify with one or more of the following qualifications:


Proficiency in programming languages like SQL or Python or C#
Experience in the development, implementation and utilization of CI/CD
Expertise in working with various Data Warehouse solutions and constructing data products using technologies such as dbt, Snowflake & databricks
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of troubleshooting and resolving complex data issues
Familiarity with agile development methodologies and DevOps practices
Understanding of the data mesh concept


Competencies

On a personal level, we anticipate that you:


Possess a collaborative and open-minded nature, eager to contribute to a globally diverse cross-functional team within the organization
Display curiosity and passion for developing innovative data products that generate value
Thrive in dynamic environments and exhibit flexibility in adapting to evolving conditions
Exhibit strong communication skills, coupled with a proactive, problem-solving approach to accomplishing tasks
Embrace a commitment to continuous learning and a desire to contribute to the collective success of the team


What We Offer

You will join a dedicated and passionate team committed to support the business through the development and scaling of data products. You will also have the possibility to be part of forming the chapter team charter and have your say in how to best build data products on a technical level. You will experience an environment that fosters continuous learning, enabling you to actualize your ambitions and get the chance to work in an agile office environment. While we hold our team members to high individual standards of collaboration, accountability, and meeting deadlines, we provide unwavering support to one another, collectively celebrating successes and addressing challenges.

Additional Information

Work location: DK, Aarhus.

Please apply no later than 19/04/2025.

BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognise the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 185 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 30,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join BESTSELLER in the journey towards analytical maturity and excellence.

As a data engineer in the Data & Analytics department at BESTSELLER you will play a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making across all our brands by designing, building, and optimizing modern data products. You will contribute to our data transformation journey, migrating from a legacy SQL-based warehouse to scalable, cloud-based data-mesh architecture using Snowflake, DBT, and Airflow.

YOUR TEAM

You will join our B2C Analytics Retail team, who is located across Aarhus and Amsterdam. We are a team dedicated to empowering retail teams across 20+ brands with cutting-edge data solutions. Our Data & Analytics department consists of 50+ colleagues passionate about driving the data agenda at BESTSELLER. We believe in empowering our people through ownership, which means taking initiative, collaborating openly, and making an impact from day one.

YOUR ROLE

You will play a significant role in maintaining and further developing our current solutions and in transforming our current data warehouse environment into a more future-proof data mesh setup. Our everyday work is made up of data analysis, data integration, and project-based tasks, all done in close collaboration with a diverse range of internal stakeholders.

Furthermore, your responsibilities will include:


Taking part in the migration of our legacy SQL-based data warehouse and data products to a new platform on Snowflake using DBT and Airflow.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Designing and implementing data pipelines, ETL processes, and data models to support business needs.
Monitoring and optimizing data warehouse performance and identifying areas for improvement.
Developing and implementing data governance policies to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and security.
Staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data engineering and cloud computing to optimize and standardize our data engineering processes in accordance with best practices.


YOUR PROFILE

We expect that you are a team player, a natural leader and that you have great communication skills. You are encouraged to bring your unique perspective and skills to the team - as diversity drives better solutions. You have a structured and curious approach to your work. To succeed in the role, you can recognize and apply best practices, methodology, tools, and techniques.

We envision you will have:


A bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field, with relevant experience in data engineering and architecture.
Expertise in Azure technologies such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, and Azure Databricks.
Expertise in SQL Server - including the ability to write stored procedures, views, and functions, with hands-on experience in data pipelines and CI/CD principles.
Experience with Snowflake, DBT, and Docker, along with knowledge of Airflow or similar workflow management tools is a plus.
Fluency in English, both spoken and written.


Your Benefits

At BESTSELLER Data & Analytics, we are passionate about new technologies and offer you the freedom to innovate with real impact on our solutions. Our hybrid workplace allows for both office and remote work, giving you the flexibility to thrive. You'll be part of a collaborative team culture in a fast-paced company with quick decision-making processes. We prioritize continuous learning and development, offering opportunities to obtain various certifications. Working in an international environment, you'll engage with diverse cultures and perspectives, making every day dynamic.

WE ARE LOOKING FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact the hiring manager, Anita Bech Borup, at +45 52 15 42 08. Otherwise, please send us your application and CV as soon as possible, no later than the 11th of April 2025. We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the job posting once the right candidate has been found.

WORKPLACE LOCATION

Hybrid work model - enjoy the flexibility of working from home while collaborating in person at either our Amsterdam or Aarhus office (minimum 2 days/week).

About Bestseller

At BESTSELLER, we are more than 20,000 people in 38 different countries working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. We are a family-owned company with a strong foundation and values to build on, empowering us to pursue the ideas we believe in to take BESTSELLER forward. We are committed to diversity and provide equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strive to create an empowering environment where people can thrive and develop. For more information, visit www.bestseller.com.
