Title: Student Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re searching for a Student Analyst to join our Commercial team based in Copenhagen Denmark!




About PureGym:




Founded in 2009, the PureGym Group is one of the largest gym operators in Europe and provides high-quality, low-cost fitness facilities. The Group has more than 2million members across 500+ gyms and holds market leading positions across the UK, Denmark and Switzerland. By providing quality gyms at affordable prices, and where everybody is welcome, we help more people in more places live healthier lives.




The Role




PureGym is looking for a Student Analyst (approx. 15-20 hours per week) to play a key role in supporting the business in making data-led commercial decisions. The essence of the role is to conduct performance tracking for us to spot and react to developments in a timely manner and to conduct ad hoc analyses to answer questions related to strategic or operational opportunities.




The Commercial Analyst will be part of a small but highly capable Commercial Management team, located in PureGym DK’s headquarters in Valby. However, you will be a part of the overall Group, which covers PureGym businesses in DK, UK and CH and a number of franchises around the world.

Therefore, the Student Analyst will have a broad interaction with colleagues from all functional areas as well as across different geographies.




Key Responsibilities:




The Student Analyst will have a leading role in the following:




Recurring performance reviews: Carry out recurring performance reviews, commenting on findings and trends
Commercial analysis: Support decision-making in the organization by conducting and presenting ad hoc analysis on business challenges
Price management: Support in generating overviews of prices, changes to member privileges and the associated performance
Execution of changes: Liaise with other teams (mainly IT, Marketing, Operations) to conduct tests to optimize commercial model/mechanisms and implement the resultant changes
Competitor analysis: Track trends in the industry and our competitive landscape




The Person




We are looking for an ambitious individual with the following core attributes:




Curious and driven: You constantly seek to learn and find new and better ways of doing things; not just solving problems but actively looking for how to improve any given situation
Love data crunching: You thrive working with large and complex data sets, finding the underlying patterns and insights
Highly structured: You enjoy bringing order to chaos and have an eye for detail – you probably like to organize your bookshelf by size or alphabet.
Operational mindset: You take pride in having a specific area of responsibility and working continuously on improving and executing this area over time.




The ideal candidate has the following qualifications:




At least one year left of study, preferably within an analytical area
Ideally has previous working experience from a full-time position, another student job or internship
Strong business acumen and a solid methodological toolkit from your studies, capable of reflecting and advising on the best approach from case to case
Ability to work with various data sources, ranging from BI data over surveys to more qualitative data
Experienced in Excel, working quickly and efficiency with all the main formulas
Speak and write English fluently
Ability to work on Mondays would be appreciated but not a necessity




Our Values




Make a difference. Excite and inspire others. ‘Own it’ and be the best we can be.

Stand Shoulder to Shoulder. Collaborate and share with each other. Include everyone and embrace uniqueness.

Focus on the detail. Care about the little things. Have determination and resilience to get the job done.

Play to Win. Improve and innovate – never get complacent. Challenge ourselves and each other. Celebrate our success.




** Please apply with your CV in English **




PureGym is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Our company mantra is ‘Everybody Welcome’ and we are dedicated to promoting a diverse and inclusive place to work. From a hiring standpoint, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to ensuring that our PureGym colleagues reflect the diversity of the nation as well as our millions of gym members we serve.




#LI-DNI

Title: Business Intelligence Student Analyst
Description:
Drive Meaningful Change

Are you ready to support an agile and dynamic BI team and grow your skills in data-driven decision-making? Join our team at Abacus Medicine Group, where you’ll play an integral part in shaping business intelligence solutions and contributing to impactful projects. You will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment, gaining hands-on experience while enhancing your technical capabilities.




Get a Glimpse of Our World

The Business Intelligence team is a young, diverse group of professionals who are passionate about data and always eager to learn. We work closely with various departments and stakeholders across the organization, ensuring that data insights are delivered in a meaningful way. We value curiosity, innovation, and collaboration within our team, making it an exciting place to grow both professionally and personally.

As a member of the BI team, you’ll find yourself working alongside experienced BI developers and supporting various business units, all while contributing to high-impact solutions. If you’re looking for a team that’s flexible, fast-moving, and always adapting to new challenges, this is the right fit for you.




Realize Your Opportunities as BI Student Analyst

The Business Intelligence Student Analyst will support the BI team by managing incoming tickets and tasks, ensuring they are resolved or assigned appropriately. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a variety of stakeholders, assist in developing BI solutions, and enhance the existing technical infrastructure. You will also gain hands-on experience working with Power BI and cloud technologies, while collaborating on projects and participating in data analyses.




Your main responsibilities include:

Managing incoming tickets for the BI team and ensuring tasks are resolved or assigned as appropriate
Building and maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders, representing the BI team’s interests
Monitoring and maintaining the BI Power BI platform
Contributing to the development of technical infrastructure, including cloud environments and front-end tools
Participating in ad-hoc analyses and assisting with analysis projects in coordination with the manager




Fuel for Your Success in the Role

We are looking for someone who is proactive, curious, self-driven, and reliable, with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. You should be eager to learn and adapt in a dynamic environment, with a strong understanding of data fundamentals.

Furthermore, we hope the following points describe you:

You are in the final year of a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Information Systems or a Data- related field.
You might already have some relevant student job experience.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
Familiarity with BI tools such as Power BI.
Basic understanding of SQL and data modeling techniques.
Exposure to cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus.
Initial experience or coursework in data integration tools (e.g., SSIS, Data Factory, or Talend).




Would you like to know more about us?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.




Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.




Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Join our team at Abacus Medicine Group, where you’ll play an integral part in shaping business intelligence solutions and contributing to impactful projects. You will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment, gaining hands-on experience while enhancing your technical capabilities.


Get a Glimpse of Our World

The Business Intelligence team is a young, diverse group of professionals who are passionate about data and always eager to learn. We work closely with various departments and stakeholders across the organization, ensuring that data insights are delivered in a meaningful way. We value curiosity, innovation, and collaboration within our team, making it an exciting place to grow both professionally and personally.

As a member of the BI team, you’ll find yourself working alongside experienced BI developers and supporting various business units, all while contributing to high-impact solutions. If you’re looking for a team that’s flexible, fast-moving, and always adapting to new challenges, this is the right fit for you.


Realize Your Opportunities as BI Student Analyst

The Business Intelligence Student Analyst will support the BI team by managing incoming tickets and tasks, ensuring they are resolved or assigned appropriately. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a variety of stakeholders, assist in developing BI solutions, and enhance the existing technical infrastructure. You will also gain hands-on experience working with Power BI and cloud technologies, while collaborating on projects and participating in data analyses.


Your main responsibilities include:

  • Managing incoming tickets for the BI team and ensuring tasks are resolved or assigned as appropriate
  • Building and maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders, representing the BI team’s interests
  • Monitoring and maintaining the BI Power BI platform
  • Contributing to the development of technical infrastructure, including cloud environments and front-end tools
  • Participating in ad-hoc analyses and assisting with analysis projects in coordination with the manager


Fuel for Your Success in the Role

We are looking for someone who is proactive, curious, self-driven, and reliable, with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. You should be eager to learn and adapt in a dynamic environment, with a strong understanding of data fundamentals.

Furthermore, we hope the following points describe you:

  • You are in the final year of a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Information Systems or a Data- related field.
  • You might already have some relevant student job experience.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
  • Familiarity with BI tools such as Power BI.
  • Basic understanding of SQL and data modeling techniques.
  • Exposure to cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus.
  • Initial experience or coursework in data integration tools (e.g., SSIS, Data Factory, or Talend).

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
Copenhagen, hybrid

This role is part of our Data team in Copenhagen. At DEPT®, we combine data, technology and marketing to solve brands’ business problems and drive revenue through a variety of digital solutions.

Job Purpose

As an Analytics Consultant at DEPT®, you work with our clients on the best data setup, implement these and educate the clients in the world of Analytics. Of course this role has its challenges. The death of the cookie is near, and in this role you will consult our clients to deal with this new reality. How do they need to set up their server-side measurement? Which new products and features should we test? How can we make the best use of Consent Mode, conversion uploads and more? And GA4. The end of the session, which is changing analytics like we know it. You like to dive into these questions and want to help our clients answer them. As an Analytics Consultant, you are the absolute expert in data collection and solving complex analytics cases. You know how to create and implement measurement setups, take care of server-to-server connections between owned and marketing platforms and help clients to implement the best data collection setup.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and configure tag management systems (eg. GTM) to ensure accurate data collection;
  • Develop measurement plans in collaboration with clients;
  • Troubleshoot and fix data discrepancies & tracking issues;
  • Conduct audits of data collection setups;
  • Collaborate with development teams to develop and maintain tracking across digital platforms;
  • Use data visualisation tools (eg. Looker Studio, Power BI) to present data in an easily understandable format;
  • Consult with clients and help them take their analytics setup to the next level.


What We Are Looking For

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data role, preferably at agency side;
  • Hands-on experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager;
  • Are proficient in Javascript;
  • Maybe you don't have the technical skills yet, but are eager to learn more about SQL, Python and Cloud;
  • Full working proficiency in the English language - spoken and written (proficiency in Danish is considered a plus, not a requirement);
  • Somebody who can switch from serious to play in a heartbeat;
  • An analytical, technical, independent profile with good communication skills.


WE OFFER

  • A healthy, varied and delicious lunch at the office;
  • A lot of fun social events such as Friday bars, company parties, team events, etc.;
  • A flexible, hybrid working policy and a great workplace in our awesome office in Christianshavn;
  • A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards;
  • Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries;
  • The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training and development;
  • Stay happy and healthy with a contribution to your health through the OpenUp platform, gym and wellness discounts, and healthy lunches at the office;
  • Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.


WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Title: Studentermedarbejder: Business Intelligence i ambitiøst konsulenthus
Description:
Er du en analytisk og teknisk dygtig studerende med interesse for Business Intelligence, dataanalyse og datamodellering? Vil du udvikle dine færdigheder i Power BI, SQL og Python i et ambitiøst konsulenthus? Så er du måske den helt rigtige til Human Engage!

 

HVAD ER DET FOR ET JOB?

Human Engage er et konsulenthus, der arbejder med kvantitative og kvalitative analyser for at skabe indsigt og forandring i organisationer. Vi har brug for en studentermedhjælper ca. 10-15 timer om ugen til at styrke vores arbejde med dataanalyse og visualisering. Din primære opgave vil være at udvikle og optimere vores BI-løsninger, herunder:

·       Udvikling af dashboards og rapporter i Power BI

·       Datahåndtering og analyse med Python (fx pandas/numpy)

·       Datamodellering med fokus på Star Schema




HVEM ER DU?

·       Du er i gang med en bachelor- eller kandidatuddannelse inden for business intelligence, data science, datalogi, økonomi med fokus på BI eller et beslægtet felt

·       Du har erfaring med Power BI, SQL og Python (pandas/numpy)

·       Du har gerne forståelse for datamodellering, herunder Star Schema

·       Du arbejder struktureret og analytisk

·       Du kan tage ansvar og arbejde selvstændigt samt indgå i et mindre team

·       Du har interesse for at omsætte data til indsigt og beslutningsgrundlag




HVEM ER VI?

Human Engage er et ambitiøst konsulenthus med et ønske om at skabe forandring og udvikling i organisationer – altid med udgangspunkt i valid viden og klar data. Gensidig respekt, ønsket om udvikling og tillid til hinanden er essentielt for os, og vi ser en stor værdi i forskellighed og rummelighed.  Vi er et mindre team på under ti personer fordelt på to kontorer i henholdsvis Odense (havnen) og Århus (Store Torv), hvor arbejdspladsen er præget af store ambitioner, gode relationer og ikke mindst højt humør!

 

HVOR OG HVORNÅR?

Din primære arbejdsplads vil være på et af vores kontorer – vi ønsker den bedste kandidat.  

Vi vurderer indkomne ansøgninger løbende, og forventer opstart snarest muligt.

 

Læs mere om os her: https://hnengage.com/om-os/  

 

KONTAKT OS:

Partner Henrik Kjærgaard Clausen

Tlf.: 28 10 11 80

Mail: hkc@hnengage.com

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Hvidovre Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer / Analytics Engineer




NTG Nordic Transport Group (NTG)

NTG is listed on Nasdaq OMX Nordic and is one of the fastest-growing freight forwarders in Europe. Since the Group’s foundation in Denmark in 2011, our unique partnering-model has successfully expanded NTG to a revenue of more than DKK 8 billion in 2023, presence in +30 countries and ~100 companies. Our culture is characterized as entrepreneurial, trusting, and accountable.




The Position

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer or Analytics Engineer to join our newly established BI team at our Global Headquarters in Hvidovre (Copenhagen), Denmark. Your main responsibilities will be:

· Develop and maintain our Data Warehouse platform

· Build and maintain data ingestion pipelines in DBT

· Design and create Analytics Models for consumption in PowerBI

· Collaborate with business users to create concise and meaningful data assets that fit our platform architecture

· Advise on the design, and optimization of our data storage solutions, ensuring best practices are followed and influencing the strategic direction of our Data Warehouse.

You will work closely with our Head of Group Business Intelligence to support our broader organization within IT, Finance and operations.




The Candidate

· Possess a strong analytical mindset

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team

· Solid communication and collaboration skills

· Previous experience with solutions like Snowflake, Databricks hosted on one of the big cloud providers (Azure, AWS or GCP)

· Proficiency with Python, SQL, dbt

· Data modelling and schema design for relational databases

· Fluent in English (Danish is a plus)

· Experience with PowerBI is a plus




How do I apply?

If you would like to join our team, apply for the position by clicking the button below. We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

We hope we got your attention and look forward to receiving your application!




If you have any questions about the position, please don't hesitate to reach out to Martin Staal-Olsen (mso@ntg.com), Christian Herskind Louring (clo@ntg.com) or Tomasz Kotarski (tko@ntg.com

Show more

Title: Student assistant - Sustainability data specialist
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll be part of our dedicated team responsible for data validation, processing, and calculation of sustainability data (certification type, feedstock types etc.) including CO2 calculations. You'll play a key role in our internal procedures for checking sustainability data provided by our suppliers. Further you'll work closely with our Sustainability Data Specialist on maintaining but also developing our internal systems responsible for deliver real-time output data requested both for internal and external stakeholders.

Welcome to Welcome to Bio Markets

You’ll be part of a dedicated team in Bioenergy Sustainability, Fuel and Logistic where you, together with your colleagues, will play a key role in securing that documentation of all sustainability requirements are delivered by our suppliers of Biomass. Especially you'll be part of the process of collecting data and documentation as well as our internal processes for validation and control. This is the cornerstone of our internal IT- systems enabling us to maintain our chain of custody certification. Furthermore, you'll assist the Sustainability Data Specialist in the work with insightful data extraction and analysis. As a team, we work close together but with individual expertise and responsibilities. You are responsible for your own workday delivering into the continuously task and responsibilities.

You’ll play an important role in:


being responsible of collecting and controlling sustainability data provided by our suppliers and having the dialogue with biomass supplier regarding data and documentation
being responsible for upstreaming CO2 emissions- and total CO2 savings calculations
securing data documentation for maintaining our FSC, PEFC and SBP Chain of custody certification
assisting in the development of data models/our systems adapted to new requirements both internal and external i.e. new regulations, EUDR, RED III etc.
being part of developing our systems to continuously adapt to new requirements (like EUDR, RED III etc.) incl. translating numerous data points into commercial insights.


To succeed in the role, you:


need to demonstrate high attention to details both in data and systems
are an experienced excel-user, with interest in data handling and interested in learning
are a basic user of R-studio or similar programming language, e.g. Python
are currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program in the field of engineering, economics, or mathematics with a high focus on or strong interest in environmental and natural science, e.g. environmental engineering, environmental economics, natural resources or similar
have general understanding of the use of biomass for energy and interest in CO2 emission calculations.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application, CV and other relevant documents to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Azure Data Engineer


Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.


cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.


Hvilken rolle får du?


Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.


Din rolle bliver at


  • rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
  • rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
  • bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
  • sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
  • fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger


Hvad forventer vi af dig?


  • Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
  • Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
  • Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
  • Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling


Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

  • Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere


Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.


Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.


Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.


Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.


Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:


Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Data Visualisation Lead - PowerBI SME
Description:
Are you passionate about driving innovation and delivering actionable insights through advanced analytics? Do you have a strong background in PowerBI and want to make a positive impact on the business? We are looking for a Data Visualization Lead to join our People Analytics unit at Novo Nordisk. If you are ready for a challenging and rewarding career, read on and apply today for a life-changing opportunity.

The position
This exciting role is a part of a transformative agenda and can be shaped as the office expands.

You will act as a technical subject matter expert (SME) in close collaboration with the team, who will support you with the analytics related to People & Organisation (P&O). You can look forward to:



Pioneering best in class People Analytics self-service solutions in PowerBI, complemented by wider Power Platform ecosystem.
Completing our migration from legacy Tableau solutions towards a centralized People Analytics Hub and influencing our strategy to improve and mature our data foundation
Leading the development and deployment of analytics models, tools, and frameworks that provide insights and drive decision-making.
Driving workstreams both independently and as part of a wider team.
Promoting a data-driven culture and increasing data literacy across the organization.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality standards and ethical data practices are being followed.




Qualifications

To be excel in this role, we imagine you should have:



Bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science & Statistics (or equivalent experience).
Expert in PowerBI, with high proficiency in both DAX and SQL, with experience in PowerApps along with the wider Power Platform ecosystem a strong benefit.
5+ years of in-depth experience with solutions involving data, business intelligence, and analytical technologies preferred (e.g. PowerBI, SQL, Alteryx)
Excellent collaboration, communication, and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into valuable recommendations for senior leaders.




About The Department

The People Analytics department is a newly formed team within People & Organisation at Novo Nordisk. Our mission is to develop a comprehensive understanding of our workforce and leverage data-driven insights to support our leaders in making informed decisions. By analyzing key trends and identifying areas for acceleration, we aim to provide actionable recommendations that enhance employee engagement, productivity, and retention. Join our team and contribute to the long-term success of Novo Nordisk.

Working at Novo Nordisk
Novo Nordisk is a leading global healthcare company with a 100-year legacy of driving change to defeat serious chronic diseases. Building on our strong legacy within diabetes, we are growing massively and expanding our commitment, reaching millions around the world and impacting more than 40 million patient lives daily. All of this has made us one of the 20 most valuable companies in the world by market cap. Our success relies on the joint potential and collaboration of our more than 72,000 employees around the world. We recognise the importance of the unique skills and perspectives our people bring to the table, and we work continuously to bring out the best in them. Working at Novo Nordisk, we’re working toward something bigger than ourselves, and it’s a collective effort. Join us! Together, we go further. Together, we’re life-changing.

Contact
For further information, please contact isre@novonordisk.com (Sam Reilly, Senior Manager – Analytics Partners & Innovation)

Deadline
30th March 2025

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV. Applications will be handled as they are received, so please do not hesitate to apply.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Embedded Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Reshape

Reshape Biotech is on a mission to transform biotechnology research through advanced automation and AI-powered data analysis. We empower research teams by automating lab processes, capturing real-time data, and providing actionable insights, accelerating the development of breakthrough products that address humanity’s critical challenges.




Join us in pioneering solutions that drive sustainability and scientific discovery at unprecedented speed.




About the role

We are seeking a Firmware Engineer to design, develop, and optimize firmware solutions that enable our devices to support novel features while operating reliably. This role involves building new features, simplifying existing functionality, improving system reliability, enhancing diagnostic capabilities, streamlining production processes, and ensuring the seamless integration of hardware and software components.




As a Firmware Engineer on our Hardware Engineering team, you will collaborate with engineers across disciplines to turn ambitious goals into reality. You will own the entire firmware development lifecycle - including design, implementation, testing, and ongoing support.

You are the engineer that other engineers can count on; you are technical; you attack every problem with enthusiasm; you remove hurdles. You are a self-starter and a team player who is eager to venture quickly into unknown code or subjects, and ensure the system works effectively. You execute tasks with minimal oversight, do not require hand-holding, and are not afraid to surface problems. Moreover, you can balance optimizing development for time-to-market with minimizing technical debt.




No experience in robotics or biotech? No problem - as long as you are curious. We are looking for ambitious and motivated engineers who love solving tough problems and want to make an impact in an inspiring, fast-paced environment.




Role responsibilities:

Execute on firmware development at a blazing pace.
Design, implement, and maintain highly reliable firmware solutions for biotech robotics systems.
Navigate all aspects of firmware engineering and product development.
Work closely with hardware engineering peers to ensure seamless integration between mechanical, electronic, firmware and software components.
Troubleshoot and resolve firmware issues, ensuring minimal downtime.
Optimize system performance, reliability, and scalability for production environments.
Collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams to identify and address system requirements.
Drive continuous improvement by identifying faults and implementing robust solutions.
Maintain highest standards of excellence, never settle for the status quo.




Basic qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, electronics engineering, computer engineering, software engineering, or related field; OR 2+ years of professional experience in firmware development in lieu of a degree.
Proficiency in high-level programming languages (e.g. Python, etc.).
Proficiency in embedded systems programming (e.g. C, C++, Rust).




Preferred skills and experience:

5+ years of experience in firmware development for robotics. electromechanical or embedded software systems.
Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
Strong knowledge of Single-Board Computers, embedded Linux and microcontroller development.
Proficiency in Python and C++.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Experience in communication protocols (e.g., I2C, SPI, UART, CAN, TCP).
Experience with system diagnostics, logging, and error handling.
Experience hardware hacking / as a maker, hands-on and ready to build (e.g. soldering, 3D printing, building electronics prototypes etc.)
Experience in hardware debugging using oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and similar tools.

Show more

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Er du klar til at dykke ned i de nyeste teknologier i Azure og Microsoft Fabric? Hos Kvik A/S har vi en mission: Vi vil bygge et vindende hold og skabe exceptionelle forretningsindsigter gennem data og applikationer. Vores mål er at vækste virksomheden og realisere vores ambitiøse digitale rejse.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


Hybrid arbejdsplads (minimum 2 dage på kontoret)
Hands-on erfaring med Microsoft Fabric
Spændende projekter samt et sjovt og udfordrende arbejdsmiljø
Muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling
Fokus på jobtilfredshed i en åben og ærlig atmosfære
Ansvar og indflydelse i et selvstændigt team


Arbejdsområder

Som BI Consultant hos Kvik A/S vil du have følgende arbejdsområder:


Analyse og afdækning af forretnings behov
Løfte og udvikle eksisterende cloud platform til Fabric setup
Design, udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger
Sikring af datakvalitet
Rådgive og understøtte stakeholders i brugen af BI-værktøjer
Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering og optimering
Tværfagligt samarbejde med andre teams om dataintegration og -analyse projekter
Vedligeholdelse og fejlfinding i eksisterende BI-systemer
Bidrage til at udforme og forbedre BI-strategier og -processer


Den ideelle kandidat

Vi ser den ideele kandidat besidde følgende:


Erfaring med SQL, Azure Data Factory, Microsoft Fabric, Python og datamodellering
Generel forståelse for agile arbejdsprincipper (DevOps) og git
Solid forretningsforståelse til at understøtte dialog med stakeholders


Om vores team

Vi er et ungt og dygtigt team, der trives med samarbejde, innovation og et omskifteligt landskab. Vi omfavner den agile metode og tror på at udfordre grænser, lære af fejl og fejre succeser sammen.

Din profil

Er du proaktiv og ansvarsfuld? Vi søger en kollega, der ikke er bange for at udfordre normen. Som BI Consultant kombinerer du teknisk viden med forretningsbehov.


Ansvar og initiativ: Du tager ansvar for dine opgaver
Nysgerrighed: Du stiller de svære spørgsmål og udforsker nye løsninger
Formidling af tekniske løsninger: Du kan oversætte komplekse tekniske begreber til forståeligt sprog for stakeholders
Samarbejde: Du trives med tværfagligt samarbejde
Minimum 2 års erfaring


For yderligere detaljer om denne fantastiske mulighed, kontakt vores Senior BI Architect, Victor D. K., på telefonnummer 22600424. Denne fuldtidsstilling er baseret hos Kvik A/S, Mosevej 3, 8240 Risskov. Der kan forekomme kørsel til hovedkontoret i Vildbjerg.

Title: Azure løsningsarkitekt
Description:
Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?




Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt




Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.




Andre ansvarsområder:

Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen




Dine kompetencer:

5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter




Om dig:

Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater




En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester




Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens førende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.




Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt særligt – og det er det vi elsker ved at være medarbejdere i Crayon.




At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.




If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

HTML:
• Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
  • Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
  • Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?


Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt


Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.


Andre ansvarsområder:

  • Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
  • Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
  • Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
  • Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen


Dine kompetencer:

  • 5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
  • Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
  • Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
  • Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
  • Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
  • Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter


Om dig:

  • Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
  • Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
  • Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater


En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

  • at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
  • at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
  • at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
  • at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
  • at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester

Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.


Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

Title: Student Assistant AI
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a student skilled in AI ready to apply your knowledge of AI and software development in a real-world setting?

Become a part of our AI and Innovation team, where we develop innovative AI solutions that reshape our interaction with technology. Our aim? To Bring People Closer through AI-driven innovation—and we want you to be part of it!

The Team You Will be Part of

Join an innovative and inclusive AI and Innovation team that thrives on collaboration and creativity! Our team consists of a collaborative group of innovative thinkers focused on providing valuable AI solutions. We believe that diverse perspectives fuel innovation, and we encourage every team member to share their ideas and insights. Together, we create a space that honors every voice, allowing everyone to engage in our collective effort to transform the way we interact with technology through AI. This position allows you to learn from knowledgeable experts and work with peers who also value the evolving landscape of AI!

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:


Develop AI Solutions: Assist in designing, coding, and testing AI applications and software tools.
Experiment & Innovate: Work with machine learning models, data processing pipelines, and automation tools.
Collaborate & Learn: Participate in brainstorming sessions, team discussions, and code reviews.
Optimize & Improve: Advance system performance, scalability, and AI model accuracy.


To fulfill your responsibilities in the role, we imagine that you:


Are currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field, with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence.
Have experience with Python, Java, or similar programming languages and an understanding of AI/ML frameworks.
Are interested in AI and its real-world applications.
Are motivated, adaptable, and willing to explore—you enjoy solving problems and experimenting with new technologies in collaboration with others.


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we warmly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value the right mindset. We consider that personal capabilities are vital for contributing to valuable results.

We prioritize creating an inclusive recruitment experience where every candidate is valued equally in the hiring process.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We support people with hearing loss to overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses, and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiasts.

Joining GN as a Student Assistant

In GN, our Student Assistants typically work 15-20 hours a week. We value flexibility and will collaborate with you to ensure your working hours complement your studies.

You also have the possibility to join the GN Students Network. This expansive network connects students from various departments and frequently hosts events like Friday happy hours, student lunches, and other engaging social activities.

How to apply?

To apply, use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 23rd of April, 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

Quick apply

You are welcome to use our Quick Apply function, where you only submit your up to date CV, including a few sentences outlining you motivation for applying – quick and easy.

We encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger on trgoenfeldtsenger@gn.com.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application!


Show more

Title: Lead Data/IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 24876

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating a new cloud environment where we’re harnessing the power of near real time data – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you’ll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team


Your experience and background:


Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/03/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

Title: Associate Data Analyst, Revenue
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc. 

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).




We’re looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Data Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you’ll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You’ll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more. 




What you'll do:
You’ll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!)
You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, helping us understand how to improve and optimise our members experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in SQL, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation in a range of areas such as revenue management, operations and strategy. For instance, you could work on testing and validating pricing and promotion based opportunities across our portfolio of apps. 
You will make contributions to the data model and could contribute to building out data pipelines
You’ll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, operations managers, and Data Engineers PLUS, you’ll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc





You have confidence in the following:
You are a data analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualisation, A/B testing, statistical knowledge and storytelling, etc, is entrepreneurial, gets excited about building from scratch, and is relentlessly experimenting in pursuit of building a product that members love. 
Supporting experimentation analytics (e.g. A/B testing, user group testing): significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping, causal inference
Manipulating complex datasets using a range of tools such as SQL and Hive
Building effective self serve tools and visualisations to help optimise decision making
Engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders such as developers, product managers, and senior management
Identifying issues and opportunities, translating business problems into analytical diagnoses and delivering insights that answer the most pressing questions
Supporting engineers and teammates in improving data quality, and specifying requirements for new data collection
Partnering with the wider analytics / data science team to solve business problems
Experience in Python is desirable but not required
Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus








About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Bumble For Friends, and Geneva. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through Kind Connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble For Friends) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Bumble For Friends is a friendship app where people in all stages of life can meet people nearby and create meaningful platonic connections. Geneva is a group and community app for people to connect based on shared interests.

  • Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus



About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Bumble For Friends, and Geneva. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through Kind Connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble For Friends) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Bumble For Friends is a friendship app where people in all stages of life can meet people nearby and create meaningful platonic connections. Geneva is a group and community app for people to connect based on shared interests.

Title: Business Data Analyst

A Global insurance company is looking for a Business Analyst to join their Data team. In this role, you’ll gather and analyse business needs, design data solutions, and support project delivery.




Essential skills of the: Business Analyst – Data




Expertise in business process mapping, data analysis, and requirements gathering.
Proficient in Azure, AWS, and data lake/data mesh concepts.

Title: Research Executive
Description:
Job Title: Research Associate

Location: West London with hybrid working 2-3 days in the office.

Salary: £28,000-36,000 per annum (depending on experience)




Are you passionate about data and market research? We’re seeking a Research Associate to join our dynamic research & consultancy business.




In this role, you’ll undertake international research, analyse data, and contribute to insightful reports across the banking, retail technology, and payments sectors. This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career in market intelligence.




What you’ll do:

Conduct primary and secondary research, including surveys and executive interviews
Analyse data and produce reports for industry leaders
Contribute to newsletters and consulting projects
Work independently and as part of larger teams on global projects
Take on project management responsibilities as you progress




What we’re looking for:

Minimum two years' post-degree experience (not necessarily in research)
Strong writing, communication, and numerical skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel
Language skills are a bonus in particular European languages




Why Join them?

This company are committed to supporting your professional development, offering a diverse and collaborative working environment. If you’re looking to develop a career in market intelligence, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst for a Teleco & Technology Organisation

Location: London (2-3 days hybrid working)

Salary: Competitive

________________________________________

Company Overview:




We are looking for a dynamic, private equity-backed business. As the company continues to grow, we are seeking a Data Analyst to contribute to our exciting journey of integrating new systems and enhancing data capabilities. As part of a dynamic team focused on system and customer migration, you'll play a pivotal role in maturing our business processes. With your expertise in data analysis, you will help drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role is ideal for professionals with a strong commercial mindset and proficiency in SQL who are ready to make a significant impact.

________________________________________




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the finance team to optimize data analysis and generate meaningful insights.
Engage in the migration process focusing on system improvement and data enhancement.
Play an active role in driving better decision-making through in-depth data insights.
Work closely with finance business partners to align data initiatives with commercial objectives.
Support the integration of HOBS (billing system) and DOMO (reporting tool) to enhance data management and reporting.

________________________________________




Required Experience:

Proven experience in data analysis with a strong commercial mindset.
Exceptional SQL skills and proficiency in working with databases.
Demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex information effectively.

________________________________________




Benefits and Opportunities

Opportunity to be at the forefront of system integration and process improvement.
Collaborate with a talented and dedicated finance team led by experienced professionals.
Be part of a structured organisation with a strategic vision for growth and innovation.
Potential for personal and professional growth by significantly impacting the company's data capabilities.

________________________________________




Candidate Profile:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with a proven capacity to turn data into actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments, particularly with finance and systems teams, to drive data-centric improvements.
Adept at balancing multiple projects and tasks while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about integrating new technologies and tools to enhance data handling and reporting.
Experience working in telecom or technology sectors is a plus, bringing industry-specific insights.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Exponential-e

Want to be part of a leading British-owned tech company? Established in 2002, we are achieving year on year revenue growth and reinvesting 95% of our profits back into our people and technology.







Your new role:

Collect, analyse, and interpret revenue operations data to identify trends and opportunities for revenue growth
Working with the systems team, develop and maintain dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights for leadership and revenue teams
Support revenue forecasting, pipeline analysis, and performance tracking
Ensure data integrity and consistency across the different platforms and tools
Conduct revenue analysis, churn analysis, and customer segmentation to improve retention and lifetime value (LTV)







What you’ll need to succeed:

Degree in Data Analytics, Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field
Experience in data analysis, preferably in a Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, or Marketing Analytics role
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Sisense, Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Experience working with CRM platforms (Salesforce) and marketing automation tools







What we offer:

Involved in varied projects that make a positive impact on critical services on a local and national level
Range of employee initiatives on offer including the green team, employee forum, women’s network and culture club
Dedicated Learning and Development team and access to a range of training, courses and certification support
Comprehensive benefits including on-site cafe with free barista coffee, birthday leave, charity leave, vitality health cover and holiday purchase scheme to gain an extra 5 days leave!
